Full Job Description
Lockheed Martin Missiles and Fire Control (MFC) is inviting talented college students to apply to our competitive Algorithm Development Internship Program to bring advanced capabilities to our innovative product lines. Click here to learn more about MFC.

Prospective students should currently be enrolled in a STEM degree program at an accredited college or university. They should have strong interests in large-scale data analysis, as well as the design and development of high-performing algorithms deployed to embedded systems. Flexible onboarding dates are available for Spring 2022 (January 2022 start dates). This internship durations can span from 3 to 6 months.

Interns participating in the Algorithm Development Program will gain valuable skills and experience in one or more of these critical technological areas and have opportunities to see their work deployed in our state of the art products:

  • Image & Signal Processing
  • Multi-Object Tracking and Object Classification
  • Supervised Machine Learning / Deep Learning / AI
  • Dynamics Modeling (6-Degrees of Freedom)
  • Optimal State Estimation & Kalman Filtering
  • Navigation (inertial, GPS-aided, terrain-aided, celestial-aided)
  • Computer Vision
  • Pattern Recognition
  • Numerical Methods
  • Probabilistic Modeling & Monte Carlo Methods
  • Multivariate Statistics and Hypothesis Testing
  • Aircraft Attitude Estimation
  • Gimbal Control and Precision Pointing
  • Physics Modeling of Motion Sensing Devices (gyros, accelerometers, magnetometers)
  • Physics Modeling and Simulation of Electro-Optical Systems (telescopes and focal plane arrays)
  • Physics of Infrared Photon Detectors
  • Radiometry
Basic Qualifications:
  • Bachelors, Masters, and PhD students specializing in Computer Science, Machine Learning/AI, Data Science, Applied Mathematics, Physics, Aerospace Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or Mechanical Engineering are especially encouraged to apply.
  • Candidates must be eligible for a DoD Security Clearance.
Desired Skills:
  • Coursework in linear algebra, multivariate calculus, and statistics
  • Familiarity with MATLAB or Python language for large-scale data analysis
  • Strong programming skills that can translate to C++ development in a Linux environment
  • A strong sense of curiosity and an innovative spirit

Full Job Description
Job Summary: Cole Engineering Services is seeking a highly motivated candidate to support activities for an emerging simulation and training capability for the United States Army. The candidate will support test and evaluation activities to include development of test procedures, supporting the execution of test and evaluation events, and performing hardware and software analysis and troubleshooting across complex military systems.

Essential Job Functions:
Candidates will support the design, creation and execution of hardware/software test cases, scenarios, and procedures that incorporates the use of a variety of software applications and tools.
Assists in defining integration and testing processes and procedures.
Performs unit testing, configuration item and system level tests, and supports verification/validation testing as required.
Develops test plans and test reports for all levels of testing performed.
Works closely with the leads, development staff and systems engineers to thoroughly understand the system requirements and hardware/software implementation.
Works closely with leadership to identify and define testing strategies and plan resources to ensure adequate assets are in place for all testing activities.
Analyzes test results, metrics and trends and provides feedback to development and systems engineers.

Required Education/Experience:
Currently seeking Bachelor’s or Graduate coursework in a related technical discipline such as mechanical engineering, electrical engineering, industrial engineering, computer science, information technology, systems or software engineering from an accredited college or university.
Position is year-round. Hours are flexible based on coursework and academic commitments.

Knowledge in any of the following areas would be considered a plus:

Hardware troubleshooting and fault diagnosis.
Knowledge and experience of testing methodologies and analyzing results from small-scale unit testing to large-scale system testing.
Knowledge/experience with Industry best-practice software development and collaboration tools such as JIRA and Confluence.
Experience operating in a collaborative work environment.

Other Requirements: Please note that pursuant to a government contract, this specific position requires U. S. Citizenship status with ability to obtain a SECRET security clearance.

Farm Credit Mid-America has a number of programs designed for college students and recent graduates. The intern program allows students to gain valuable experience working with a mentor over the summer. Competitive pay, meaningful work and a strategic intern project provides our interns with many opportunities for professional and personal growth. BASIC FUNCTION: The intern will spend the summer working to collect, organize, analyze and recommend process improvements to maximize the success of the Farm Credit Mid-America’s Quality Assurance team processes.

$17.00 per hour

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES

Full Job Description
We see boundless potential in the way we live. It drives the way we work. Our culture is our most valuable asset. It acts like a compass for us. We are fast, immersed, humble and bold. And that’s not just words on the walls.

Eliminating time-consuming tasks means people get to do more of what they love. It’s an inspiring, high stakes challenge that motivates us, and this common passion bonds UiPath employees globally. We all strive every day to be better and to accelerate human achievement.

We make software robots, so people don’t have to be robots. Would you like to be part of this journey?

We are in hyper-growth mode and looking for a customer obsessed Product Management intern to help drive digital transformation for UiPath. We want someone with a passion to innovate, who likes working backwards from the customer and can handle complex problems. As an intern on the UiPath PM team, you will help deliver customer value through new features that cross systems of engagement, systems of record and systems of insight. You will learn about end-to-end ownership of areas from writing specifications, working with developers to execute them to evangelizing the product and ensuring a timely and high-quality delivery. You will work closely with product managers, engineering and user experience designers to build features that customers love. If that sounds like you, let's talk!

What you will be doing at UiPath:
Product specifications: Work with design teams to build user experiences and define specifications to enable new scenarios in our products.
Help feature development: Work closely with the engineering team to drive the execution and delivery of features and products. Mitigate any risks and ensure dependencies are handled appropriately. Test features and ensure they are of the highest quality.
Evangelize product: Articulate and share our product vision. Create relevant collateral including presentations, white papers and documents to demonstrate value.
Market Intelligence: Understand the competition and strategize around how to beat them.

What you’ll bring to UiPath:
A strong fundamental understanding of Computer Science through pursuit of a Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD degree in Computer Science, Math, or a related discipline
1+ years of experience in the software industry either in a development or product management capacity (projects or former internships)
Experience working with cross-disciplinary teams across the organization including engineering, marketing, UX
Ability to effectively communicate to stakeholders at all levels of the organization—from the end user (technical buyer) to the decision maker (economic buyer)—with excellent written, oral, and presentation skills.
Experience working in RPA, AI or BPM is a plus
Self-starter with a growth mindset, adaptability, and a drive for continuous improvement
Life at UiPath can sometimes feel like a roller coaster. It comes with changes, healthy challenges, and the opportunity to build solutions from the ground up, have great impact, and learn a great deal.

At UiPath, we value a range of diverse backgrounds experiences and ideas. We pride ourselves on our diversity and inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, national origin, disability, military and/or veteran status, or any other protected classes.

We are seeking motivated undergraduate students for Co-Op and Internship opportunities to work as part of our i-Ready engineering team. Be proud of the impact you will have on 8 million students across the country building educational software for the fastest growing company in the EdTech industry and one of Boston Globe’s Top Places to Work 2014-2020.

Please be aware that given COVID-19, this will likely be a remote position, with the possibility of working from our North Billerica, MA home office if conditions change.

How to apply:
Apply here with your resume and any other docs you want us to see (transcripts, cover letter, etc.)

Sessions available:
6-month Co-Op, January-June 2022 (40 hours per week)

3-month Internship, June-August 2022 (40 hours per week)

6-month Co-Op, June-December 2022 (40 hours per week)

Our Commitment to Diversity:
At Curriculum Associates (CA), we believe a diverse team leads to diversity in thinking, making our products better for teachers and students. If you read this job description, feel energized by what you see here, and believe you could bring passion and commitment to the role, but you aren’t sure you meet every qualification, please apply! Above all, we are looking for the right person!

Our philosophy:
We believe that in your time with us as a co-op or intern, you should have the opportunity to accomplish meaningful work, while growing as an engineer. You will be placed on (and become an integral part of) a team comprised of people from many different groups including designers, project managers, etc., and you will also be part of a larger community including your peers of other co-ops and interns. We will work with you to make sure you are gaining the experience and skills you want. You will start off with smaller assignments to understand our tools and processes, and ramp-up to more complicated, larger assignments as you learn and apply. You will be exposed to many different aspects of software engineering, all the while completing meaningful work that moves your team(s) forward.

“A successful term at CA will result in co-ops eventually doing the same work as their experienced teammates and learning applicable technical and business skills aligned as much as possible to their personal goals.” – CA Director of Engineering

What to expect:
Develop features that directly benefit our users: K-12 students and teachers
Ensure code quality through testing (unit, integration, and end-to-end) and reviewing other team members’ code
Work closely with team members in product and design
Take ownership of designing and implementing engineering solutions to enhance our product

You would be a good fit if you…

Have experience in any of the tech we use (take a peek below – we don’t expect you to know all of it)
Want to make a positive social impact
Have a knack for solving complex problems in efficient and creative ways
Enjoy working on a collaborative team

… but you simply must…

Be an undergraduate student with completion of at least one year in an engineering discipline, computer science, or mathematics or have similar experience – some programming knowledge is required for this position
Graduating 1/1/2022 or later OR enrolled in an educational program (school, code bootcamp, etc.) ending 1/1/2022 or later
Have a 3.0+ GPA (if it’s lower but you think you would be a good fit, please write a few sentences or provide other evidence and upload it as an additional document!)
Be able to work 40 hours a week (business hours, eastern time zone) for the 6-month duration of the co-op or 3-month duration of the summer internship 2022
Not have held a full-time position in a software engineering role (we do not consider Internships/Co-Ops as full-time; we love to see previous experience!)
Reside in the United States and be in enrolled in a US program/institution

JavaScript (ES6)
React/Redux
Java
Spring/Hibernate
SQL
AWS
Git

About Curriculum Associates:
Curriculum Associates is a rapidly growing educational technology and publishing company committed to making classrooms better places for teachers and students. We believe that—with the right materials and support—all children have the ability to succeed, and this idea inspires our engineering, product development, and service teams every day. About Kemper

Kemper is one of the nation’s leading specialized insurers. Our success is a direct reflection of the talented and diverse people who make a positive difference in the lives of our customers every day. We believe a high-performing culture, valuable opportunities for personal development and professional challenge, and a healthy work-life balance can be highly motivating and productive. Kemper’s products and services are making a real difference to our customers, who have unique and evolving needs. By joining our team, you are helping to provide an experience to our stakeholders that delivers on our promises.

We employ 10,000 associates within our family of companies and are growing! At Kemper, we foster a culture of ownership and accountability where high performance and strong contributions are recognized, valued, and rewarded. Add to that our growing auto, home, life and health business segments across the U.S. and you’ve got endless potential.

Kemper’s Internship Program

Kemper’s internships will enable you to broaden your understanding of the business, make valuable connections, and set a course for your professional journey with us. You will work on special projects that positively impact our business and our customers.

Kemper is looking for students who love to problem solve and are willing to a make real-life impact on projects that may involve the senior executives to front-line associates. We deliver meaningful experiences in various internship areas like Product Development, Claims, Operations, Finance, IT, Data Analytics, and much more. Are you ready to create your own journey by joining ours?

What Kemper’s Internship Provides

12-week paid summer internship
Challenging projects that support the company's objectives
Real-time constructive feedback
A resource team to assist with training and career development
Collaboration with managers who have excellent business acumen
Opportunities to interact with the senior leadership team
Group activities, including virtual networking events and volunteer activities
Dedicated program managers and knowledgeable mentors
Lasting career connections with fellow interns

Intern Responsibilities

Work alongside analysts and data scientists to understand how the business needs to be analyzed and understood
Create custom focused data assets from approved sources for use by analysts and data scientists in the aligned business area (data marts, assets underlying BI layers and reports)
Reasonable proficiency in data manipulation skills in SQL, Python, or equivalent.
Experience using BI Tools such as Tableau, or equivalent

Intern Requirements & Qualifications

Must be enrolled in an accredited bachelor’s degree program, with a scheduled graduation between December 2022 and June 2023
Qualifying majors include computer science, data science, business analysis, finance, statistics, mathematics, or a related field
A minimum 3.0 GPA on a 4.0 GPA scale
Proficient computer skills, including Microsoft Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, Excel)
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Energetic and eager to tackle new projects
Self-directed and able to work with little supervision
Interest in insurance and financial services
Good collaborative and relationship-building skills
This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship

Kemper is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, disability status or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. We are committed to supporting diversity and equality across our organization and we work diligently to maintain a workplace free from discrimination.

Kemper does not accept unsolicited resumes through or from search firms or staffing agencies. All unsolicited resumes will be considered the property of Kemper and Kemper will not be obligated to pay a placement fee.

position: 2022 Charles Schwab Technology Internal Audit Internship
description:
Full Job Description
Your Opportunity

Do you want to spend your summer internship with a company that has been challenging the conventions of the financial services industry for over 45 years? Schwab’s mission is to help our clients build a better future for themselves, their families, and their communities. It is summed up in our tagline – Own your tomorrow – and it permeates everything we do.

The design of the program invites interns to engage directly in Schwab’s culture of service, while challenging them with a blend of learning programs, team-building activities, networking opportunities, and enriching work projects. Features of our 2022 program include:

Business Track Project: Working with your host business track at Schwab provides a meaningful and valuable experience to translate classroom learning into real business projects.
Intern Cohort Project: Partner with other interns to brainstorm, discuss learning experiences, and present solutions.
Learning Activities: Participate in facilitated training, team discussions and events, individual assessments and activities, senior leader meetings, and on-the-job training.
Dedicated Intern Leader: Receive regular feedback from your leader, participate in career-related discussions, and provide your own feedback.
Strengths Application: Learn about yourself and how to apply your unique strengths, abilities, and goals to the work you do as part of Schwab’s ‘strengths-based’ culture.
Networking: Build your network by interacting with professionals across Schwab, including senior leaders, peers, and Schwab Intern Academy Alumni.

Because interns are considered a primary pipeline for full-time opportunities, every intern candidate must be eligible for full-time employment upon graduation and must also meet the following requirements:

Enrolled in a current undergraduate or graduate program tracking to graduate between December 2022 and May/June 2023
Ability to work full time and be on-site at assigned Schwab location during the 9-week program (June 6 to August 5, 2022)
Have specific skills as specified by the hosting Business Track

Schwab is recognized as an industry leader, and our welcoming culture will embrace your individuality and partner you with other like-minded and solution-focused students. We will invest in your summer experience by providing you direction and leadership for a robust and well-rounded internship, as well as helping you focus on a potential future career with Schwab.

Regardless of which opportunity you pursue, we will provide you with a consistent and outstanding experience – one you won’t soon forget!

What you are good at

We look for students with:
Optimism and curiosity, who possess a keen sense of purpose, awareness, and knowledge and who have the demeanor of an everyday leader
Resourcefulness and flexibility, who enjoy working through cross-functional partnerships and collaboration to achieve a common purpose
An innovative and questioning demeanor, who constantly look for better ways to do things, have a passion for service, and seek to exceed client expectations
What you have

A strong desire to build and grow a career in the financial services industry
Outstanding written and oral communication skills
The courage to ask “why”!

As an affirmative action employer, Schwab takes affirmative action to employ qualified minorities, women, individuals with disabilities, and protected veterans in our intern program. As a culture that values Diversity and Inclusion, Schwab encourages the application of Women, Minorities, Individuals with Disabilities and Protected Veterans to the Intern Academy.

There are many different business tracks that you can engage with over the course of the summer. Some of the tracks that will host 2022 interns are:

Corporate Risk Management
Digital Services
Finance
Front Line Risk Management
Human Resources
Internal Audit
Investor and Client Service
Marketing
Model Risk Management
Operations
Retirement Business Services
Schwab Asset Management Solutions
Schwab Branch Network
Schwab Technology Services
Workplace Financial Services

You can find additional program information at:
https://jobs.schwabjobs.com/internship-academy

We encourage you to apply for all positions for which you are qualified and interested. To formally apply and be considered, use this link:

jobs.Schwabjobs.com

Internal Audit Department

The Internal Audit Department (IAD) of The Charles Schwab Corporation provides independent and objective assessments to determine whether all significant risks are identified and appropriately reported by management and risk functions to the Board and Executive Management, to evaluate whether risks are adequately controlled, and to challenge Executive Management to improve the effectiveness of governance processes, risk management, and internal controls. The department is split into five Enterprise Teams; Technology, Broker-Dealer, Bank, Corporate, and Professional Practices.

Internal Audit interns will be aligned to specific Enterprise Teams during their internship. All interns will have the opportunity to participate in department wide functions and will have exposure to other departments within Internal Audit.

Technology

The technology department is responsible for the execution of infrastructure, application, and project audits. Infrastructure audits focus on systems and technology that support and secure Charles Schwab applications with a focus on areas such as cybersecurity, data center, IT operations, organizational change, network security, and cloud computing. Application audits focus on automated functionality and data integrity that support business processes such as segregation of duties, configuration management, system interfaces, and data processing. Project audits are assessments over key initiatives to determine whether intended business objectives were met and to identify risks or issues early.

Degree Programs Considered: Information Systems, Computer Science, Accountancy, Internal Audit, Business Technology

What you will do

You will assist in planning and executing audits across multiple Schwab organizations.
You will participate in internal team meetings, as well as meetings with the business.
You will perform internal audit controls testing and issue follow-up testing.
You will assist with Internal Audit operational tasks such as management of audit status, issue status, audit file preparation and implementation.
You will be responsible for managing your own tasks and letting teams know of your availability for work.
What you have
Strong communication skills (written and verbal).
Self-starter with strong organizational skills.
Ability to multitask and run multiple projects (2-3), demonstrating an ability to analyze and prioritize to meet multiple client needs.
Ability to work as a member of a project team and cultivate a strong working relationship with external co-sourcing providers and internal lines of businesses.
Demonstrates ability to learn and grow.
Initiative to research, understand and analyze a variety of situations or processes.
What you will learn
You will learn how to analyze and understand highly complex business problems that are part of operating in the financial industry.
You will spend time executing and examining various audit plans and learn control testing strategies.
You will learn how to execute internal audits in accordance with department procedures.
You will learn how to identify and assess inherent risk and controls to mitigate those risks.
You will learn how to perform audit issue follow-up and how document results of that testing.
You will experience and learn about how Internal Audit operates in a highly regulated environment.
You will learn how Internal Audit operates within the enterprise risk management framework as the third line of defense.
Why work for us?

Own Your Tomorrow embodies everything we do! We are committed to helping our employees ignite their potential and achieve their dreams. Our employees get to play a central role in reinventing a multi-trillion-dollar industry, creating a better, more modern way to build and manage wealth.

Benefits: A competitive and flexible package designed to empower you for today and tomorrow. We offer a competitive and flexible package designed to help you make the most of your life at work and at home—today and in the future. Explore further.

Schwab is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, our policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to any status that is protected by law. Please click here to see the policy.

Schwab is an affirmative action employer, focused on advancing women, racial and ethnic minorities, veterans, and individuals with disabilities in the workplace. If you have a disability and require reasonable accommodations in the application process, contact Human Resources at applicantaccessibility@schwab.com or call 800-275-1281.

TD Ameritrade, a subsidiary of Charles Schwab, is an Equal Opportunity Employer. At TD Ameritrade we believe People Matter. We value diversity and believe that it goes beyond all protected classes, thoughts, ideas, and perspectives.

Full Job Description
Over 87% of our interns rate their experience with us as well above average. That's because we take care to make sure that your classroom learning is really put to use on real projects.

In 2020, Ahern was named the ENR Midwest Specialty Contractor of the Year. Building this first class reputation in the industry since 1880 did not happen by chance. It has developed over time through our commitment to conducting business ethically and by providing continuous learning, improvement and development opportunities for our number one asset, employees. You owe it to yourself to find out what Ahern has to offer!

We are hiring a software development intern to work in our Fond du Lac headquarters.

This is a year-round internship; during the school year, this position is part-time (approximately 20 hours per week) based on your class schedule and our company’s business hours, which are Monday through Friday, 8 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. During the summer and school breaks, the position is 40 hours per week.

How you will contribute:
You will work independently on delegated tasks under the direction of the IT Applications Manager and other key IT team members to do a variety of projects that have a direct impact and contribution to the business. This internship will truly provide a range of experiences as projects will be both traditional software development (maintaining and creating business application software) as well as modeling and creating process automations using UIpath RPA tool. The applications will be a mix of web and mobile utilizing Microsoft Visual Studio, SQL Server. On-the-job and web-based training will be provided as needed to get you comfortable and productive in these technologies.

What you need to qualify:
You should have two years of college coursework completed in a computer science or related four year degree program. Knowledge of programming concepts and a strong attention to detail will be critical.

What's in it for you?

Ahern offers a structured, hands on and challenging internship experience. Interns are treated like entry level full time employees. Talented, results minded Interns step to the front of the line for full time positions.

Ahern is an Affirmative Action / Equal Opportunity Employer and encourages veterans, women, minorities, and disabled individuals to apply.

Raytheon Technologies is a technology and innovation leader specializing in defense, homeland security and other government markets throughout the world. With a history of innovation spanning 90+ years, the company provides state-of-the-art electronics, mission systems integration and other capabilities in the areas of sensing; effects; and command, control, communications and intelligence systems, as well as cyber security and a broad range of mission support services.

At Raytheon Technologies, we transform data into intelligence. As a leading systems and solutions provider of intelligence, security, and advanced information technologies to government customers in the United States and internationally, Raytheon Technologies provides the right knowledge at the right time, enabling our customers to make timely and accurate decisions to achieve mission goals of national significance.

Engineering solves some of the most difficult technology challenges in our industry. We deliver high-performance solutions and provide a robust technology pipeline to fuel business growth today and beyond. Would you like to work in a collaborative environment at an amazing facility in Indianapolis? position: Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES) Associate Intern (June 2022- May 2023)
description:
Full Job Description
At Bristol Myers Squibb, we are inspired by a single vision – transforming patients’ lives through science. In oncology, hematology, immunology and cardiovascular disease – and one of the most diverse and promising pipelines in the industry – each of our passionate colleagues contribute to innovations that drive meaningful change. We bring a human touch to every treatment we pioneer. Join us and make a difference.

Position Summary

As a Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES) Associate Intern on the Corporate IT Digital Plant MES team, you will be a key contributor to the design, development, maintenance, and support of a common library of objects and recipes that are utilized by manufacturing plants worldwide and support the continued evolution of tools and capabilities for improved end-user experience.

You will work with management, engineering, manufacturing, vendors, and IT resources from ERP/LIMS/CMMS and other systems to deliver enhancements to the MES platform. You will also have an opportunity to work with a variety of technologies such as C#/VB.NET, VBScript, SQL Server, HTML/CSS, OPC, HMI, barcode scanners, and RFID.

Key Responsibilities

Work with site functional teams including manufacturing, technology, engineering, and quality to gather user requirements for changes and enhancements
Convert user requirements into process and system requirements and build solutions to these specifications
Support development and troubleshooting of MES recipes and other components that support manufacturing operations.
Understand and track customer complaints and technical issues, the progress of vendor inquiries, and work through issues to resolution
Develop and maintain training resources, guides and other material
Develop and execute manual unit test suites as well as perform unit and integration testing
Review and provide detailed feedback on peer design and source code

What You Will Learn

The MES Associate internship position will allow the intern to learn and develop on the various technologies that go into building, supporting, and maintaining BMS's Enterprise MES solution. This can include building recipe objects with Syncade Recipe Authoring (RA), coding RA behaviors utilizing VBScript, using HTML/CSS to build user displays or batch reports, utilizing SQL to obtain data to support site queries, unit or system testing to validate any current MES objects, or working with the manufacturing sites to build out recipes for their processes, and the list goes on. Because of the many facets of MES, this position would support intern development by allowing the intern to learn and develop on the skills that interest them.

Qualifications and Experience

Working towards a bachelor’s in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, or similar
HTML/CSS, C#, VBScript, SQL, XML/XPath experience appreciated
Jira/Confluence experience appreciated
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, PowerPoint, Excel) is a must

Additional Requirements:
Candidates must be available for an internship that will run from June 2022- May 2023

Candidates must be available to be able to commute to the BMS- Tampa, FL location for the year internship (Up to 40 hours per week in summer and up to 20 hours per week in fall & spring)

Candidates must be actively enrolled in school during the internship with a graduation date of May 2023 or later

Around the world, we are passionate about making an impact on the lives of patients with serious diseases. Empowered to apply our individual talents and diverse perspectives in an inclusive culture, our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues.

Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives.

Full Job Description
The Role: Software Engineer - Intern

The Engineering Summer Internship is an opportunity to gain exposure to one or more Nutanix engineering roles according to your skills and interests. Some potential roles include (but not limited to) working on the core data path, storage and filesystems development, distributed systems, infrastructure and platform/hardware deployment, data protection and replication, tools and automation, development of a big data processing platform, development of the API and analytics platform, and Web and front-end UI/UX development.

Each intern is paired with a Member of Technical Staff (Software Engineer) who serves as a guide through our engineering culture, toolsets, and development methodology. Our internship program also includes a series of training and development, community building, and social events to expose you to other aspects of a rapidly growing Silicon Valley technology company. This a full time, 10-12 week internship program, and will be in-person at our HQ if deemed safe per CDC guidelines.

Responsibilities:
Architect, design, and development software for the Nutanix Enterprise Cloud Platform
Develop a deep understanding of complex distributed systems and design innovative solutions for customer requirements
Work alongside development, test, documentation, and product teams to deliver high-quality products in a fast pace environment
Deliver on an internship project over the course of the program. Present the final product to engineering leadership.

Requirements:
Love of programming and skilled in one of the following languages: C++, Python
Extensive knowledge or experience with Linux or Windows
Have taken courses or completed research in the areas of operating systems, files systems, big data, machine learning, compilers, algorithms and data structures, or cloud computing
Knowledge of large scale distributed systems preferred
Knowledge of NFS, SMB protocols preferred
Interest or experience working with virtualization technologies from VMware, Microsoft (Hyper-V), or Redhat (KVM) preferred
Detailed oriented with strong focus on code and product quality
The passion & ability to learn new things, while never being satisfied with the status quo

Qualifications and Experience:
Pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or a related engineering field required. If pursuing a PhD, please refer to the careers page for other opportunities.

About us
Founded in 2009 and headquartered in San Jose, California, Nutanix is a passionate team of 6000+ employees worldwide. Our people (we call ourselves “Nutants”) are the heartbeat of #LifeAtNutanix and one of the many things that makes Nutanix a great place to work at. We share anintellectual curiosity, a bias for action, and an obsession for our customers. We are builders and problem solvers with an entrepreneurial spirit. Above all, we celebrate what makes each of us unique.

We are humbled to be recognized as one of Bloomberg’s Top 50 Companies to Watch in 2020and one of the Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For® 2020.

We’re growing fast and disrupting the computing industry. Join us and make your mark.

About our business
Nutanix is a global leader in cloud software and a pioneer in hyperconverged infrastructure solutions, making computing invisible anywhere. Companies around the world use Nutanix software to leverage a single platform to manage any app, at any location, at any scale for their private, hybrid, and multi-cloud environments.

We’re an equal opportunity employer
Nutanix is an Equal Employment Opportunity and (in the U.S.) an Affirmative Action employer. Qualified applicants are considered for employment opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other category protected by applicable law. We hire and promote individuals solely on the basis of qualifications for the job to be filled.

We strive to foster an inclusive working environment that enables all our Nutants to be themselves and to do great work in a safe and welcoming environment, free of unlawful discrimination, intimidation, or harassment. As part of this commitment, we will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. If you need a reasonable accommodation, please let us know by contacting CandidateAccommodationRequests@nutanix.com

Full Job Description
Note
Employer will not sponsor visas for position
Job Summary

This is a an Information Technology Internship position for the summer of 2022 at the CITGO Corpus Christi Refinery. The IT Intern will be introduced to the Refinery and the Information Technology Department. They will become familiar with IT policies, processes, and procedures. The student will provide assistance to technical projects and services throughout their assignment. They will also work on personal computer hardware delivery and setups, load personal computer software images and work on basic personal computer tech/help desk support.

CITGO’s Attractive benefits:
  • Sliding salary scale based on classification
  • Relocation assistance may be available and will be determined by Human Resources.
Headquartered in Houston, Texas, CITGO Petroleum Corporation is a recognized leader in the refining industry with a well-known brand. CITGO operates three refineries located in Corpus Christi, Texas; Lake Charles, La.; and Lemont, Ill., and wholly and/or jointly owns 48 terminals, nine pipelines and three lubricants blending and packaging plants. With approximately 3,500 employees and a combined crude capacity of approximately 769,000 barrels-per-day (bpd), CITGO is ranked as the fifth-largest, and one of the most complex independent refiners in the United States. CITGO transports and markets transportation fuels, lubricants, petrochemicals and other industrial products and supplies a network of approximately 4,900 locally owned and operated branded retail outlets in 30 states and the District of Columbia. CITGO Petroleum Corporation is owned by CITGO Holding, Inc. For more information, visit www.CITGO.com.

  • CITGO is an Equal Opportunity Employer*
Minimum Qualifications

  • Must be currently enrolled in a Bachelor's or graduate degree program, Must be at least a Junior level in Computer Science, Management Information Systems or other relevant discipline.
  • Overall GPA of 3.0 or above (A=4.0) and must provide proof of GPA at time of hire to verify eligibility requirements.
  • PC hardware and software installation experience

Full Job Description
Summary of Major Responsibilities:
We are seeking a highly motivated Machine Learning Intern (MA/MD-based or remote) to join the Biostatistics and Informatics team. You will leverage multiple assay data to lead the development of machine learning methods to enable earlier cancer localization from liquid biopsy. You will conduct analyses on rich, high-dimensional data to drive the development of a state-of-the-art AI engine to predict cancer tissue of origin. In close collaboration with machine learning scientists, statisticians, data scientists, and technology teams, you will help build high quality, scalable solutions to address a critical unmet medical need.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Find cancer tissue of origin signal in blood-based multiple assay data.
Develop machine learning models and AI solutions to explore the accuracy of early cancer localization, including, but not limited to: feature engineering, statistical analysis, understanding classifier performance, and ensuring fit-for-purpose.
Explore a variety of metrics to evaluate cancer localization models.
Partner with machine learning scientists, statisticians, data scientists, and technology teams to develop a cancer localization prototype for the CancerSEEK product.
Communicate results in internal and external forums to support scientific, regulatory and business objectives.
Uphold company mission and values through accountability, innovation, integrity, quality, and teamwork.
Support and comply with the company’s Quality Management System policies and procedures.
Regular and reliable attendance.

Qualifications:
Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Computational Biology, Applied Mathematics or related quantitative fields, preferably with a focus on artificial intelligence or machine learning in junior or senior standing.
3+ years’ experience programming and computing skills (e.g., Python, R).
1+ year’s experience with supervised and unsupervised machine learning algorithms and ensemble methods (e.g., using scikit-learn package).
Intellectual curiosity and the ability to learn quickly in a complex space, and be willing to work in dynamic, fast-paced, creative, collaborative and data-driven team.
Authorization to work in the United States without sponsorship.
Demonstrated ability to perform the Essential Duties of the position with or without accommodation.

Preferred Qualifications

Master’s degree with a focus on artificial intelligence or machine learning.
At least one significant project leveraging machine learning (ML) methods or models.
Strong programming and computing skills (e.g, Python, R).
Previous experience with cancer diagnostics or healthcare data analyses.
Familiar with cancer biology, technical proficiency and creativity, and a strong capacity for innovative thinking.

We are an equal employment opportunity employer. position: Group 59-Summer Research Program--Cyber System Exploitation Intern
description:
Full Job Description
About the Cyber System Assessment Group:
The Cyber System Assessments Group performs software and hardware reverse engineering, vulnerability research and discovery, and system exploitation. We develop and prototype cutting-edge capabilities for our operational partners in the U.S. government. We look for, find, and demonstrate cyber vulnerabilities so that vulnerabilities in U.S. systems can be corrected, and so that vulnerabilities in other systems are better understood. Top U.S. Government leadership relies on us for our expert guidance, and our technical role with our U.S. Government sponsors is considered essential to the success of their missions.

Position Description:
Cyber System Exploitation Intern

When you join our team as a Cyber System Exploitation Intern, you'll be contributing to the development of cybersecurity tools and techniques. You'll be reverse engineering and exploiting software and hardware systems important to the U.S government operations and critical to the defense of our nation. Your main areas of research will include cyber tool prototyping and technical analysis of offensive or defensive cyber tools and systems, automated vulnerability discovery, reverse engineering, software protection mechanisms, static analysis, and dynamic instrumentation. Once you’re on our team, you will communicate your research to non-domain experts through your writing, public presentations, and hands-on training sessions.

Requirements:
Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related coursework in at least two of the following topic areas: Operating Systems, Distributed Systems, Programming Languages, Mathematics or Algorithms. Candidate should also have proficiency in Python and C/C++ programming, or similar languages.

The successful candidate must be an existing or rising college student in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Math, Physics, or related program. Preference will be given to rising seniors.

Desired Technical Skills (Some use, including in classwork, of many of these technologies):

Version Control Systems (Git)
Dissassemblers/Decompilers (Ghidra, IDAPro)
Debuggers (WinDbg, GDB)
Programming Languages (C/C++, Python)
Infrastructure/Container Provisioning/Orchestration Systems (Ansible, Kubernetes, Docker)
Network Protocol Analysis (Wireshark, Tcpdump)
Emulator/Virtualization Technologies (VMWare, QEMU)
Operating System Internals
Reverse Engineering of Embedded Systems Firmware, Malicious Code, Mobile Applications, and More + Vulnerability Assessment
Statistics and Metrics
SAT/SMT Solvers
Symbolic Execution
Data-flow Analysis for Compiled Binaries
Binary Intermediate Representations
Binary Translation
Compiler Construction
Anti-debugging/Anti-instrumentation Techniques
Network and Host Security Products
Vulnerability Assessment

Selected candidate will be subject to a pre-employment background investigation and must be able to obtain and maintain a Secret level DoD security clearance.

MIT Lincoln Laboratory is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, veteran status, disability status, or genetic information; U.S. citizenship is required.

Requisition ID: 34865

Full Job Description

Eko is a venture-backed digital health company which harnesses the power of smartphones and cloud data for screening and monitoring individuals with cardiovascular diseases. We have built a platform of non-invasive cardiovascular monitoring devices, clinical software, and point-of-care decision support software to improve the delivery of cardiovascular care.

In 2015, we launched the Eko Core Digital Stethoscope, the first FDA-cleared digital stethoscope on the market to wirelessly stream heart and lung sounds to HIPAA-compliant software. It is now used by clinicians at over 1000 hospitals & health systems around the globe and was recognized as a “Best Invention of the Year” by TIME Magazine. Eko's latest FDA-cleared device, DUO, is the first combined digital stethoscope and ECG cardiac monitor with cardiac AI for in-clinic and at-home monitoring, offering 28 million heart disease patients the ability to seamlessly send cardiac data to their physicians.

Eko was established in 2013 and has offices in Oakland and Hayward.

In November 2020, Eko raised $65 million in Series C funding. The new funding will be used to expand in-clinic use of the company’s platform of telehealth and AI algorithms for disease screening, and to launch a monitoring program for cardiopulmonary patients at home.

Eko’s data science team builds digital signal processing and machine learning algorithms that form the basis of Eko’s stethoscope AI offerings. The intern will contribute to expanding the AI’s capabilities to new areas of cardiac disease diagnostics, and optimize machine learning models to run efficiently on diverse hardware platforms from cloud servers to embedded firmware.

As a Data Science Intern, You Will:

  • Develop, implement and test algorithms to detect cardiovascular conditions and improve patient care.
  • Work with multiple data sources including data from clinical partners as well as Eko’s proprietary audio and EKG sensors.
  • Build state of the art machine learning models which leverage deep neural networks, and biomedical signal processing algorithms.
  • Work collaboratively with other data scientists as well as product, clinical and software teams at Eko.

As a Data Science Intern, You Have:

  • Currently enrolled as a PhD student in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Bioengineering, or a related subject. Preference will be given to candidates intending to graduate within the next year.
  • Hands-on experience of machine learning and data mining: classification, clustering, or time-series analysis.
  • Expertise in signal processing, optimization, statistics, and machine learning demonstrated through previous work experience or publications in top academic venues.
  • Experience with scientific software development packages including: python, numpy, scipy, pytorch, tensorflow, pandas, scikit-learn.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

As a Data Science Intern, We Would Appreciate If You Have:

  • Experience working with medical devices or biomedical data analysis.
  • Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure or GCP.
  • Experience with deep model reduction techniques such as pruning, quantization, and knowledge distillation.

Benefits and Perks We Offer:

  • Eko was recognized by “Great Place to Work” in 2020 and 2021
  • Work from home equipment stipend
  • Flexible schedules

Eko is elevating the way clinicians detect and monitor cardiac and respiratory disease by bringing together advanced sensors, patient and provider software, and AI-powered analysis. Its FDA cleared platform is used by tens of thousands of clinicians treating millions of patients around the world, in-person, and through telehealth. The company is headquartered in Oakland, California and privately-held, with investments from ARTIS Ventures, NTT Venture Capital, DigiTx Ventures, Mayo Clinic, Sutter Health and others.

_
Eko is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives. We celebrate diversity and are committed to building a diverse and inclusive team._

Full Job Description
At DISH, hard work is rewarded with limitless opportunities. More than your education and previous work experience, we look for individuals who are bright, energetic and ambitious. We believe the critical thinking skills you learn in college can be applied across a variety of business functions, regardless of your major. This is what sets us apart as an employer.

Our program is designed to give you comprehensive experience in the fast-paced world of wireless and technology industries. Working full-time and with hands-on field experience and business projects, you will get an in-depth look at how our business works and where you fit into it. Help us build our brand while we help you build yours.

Interns working within our technology space, whether in DISH, SLING or Wireless, will evaluate current practices and play tangible parts in our business strategy. The scope of your work will be defined by the opportunities you create for yourself. Your potential duties could include working on an internal employee tool, internally developed app or even a product that millions of customers use. You might design a new dashboard for easier data consumption or a system for process improvement.

Job Duties and Responsibilities

Interns who love solving complex problems can support our technology teams in a number of ways. You will get to work with senior engineers to help accomplish your goals, no matter which role you choose!

Data Scientist

You will work to discover information hidden in vast amounts of data and help make smarter decisions to deliver better products and services. You will communicate to stakeholders the value of the decision and the results it will provide them.

Embedded Engineer

You will get to work in a dynamic development environment and be responsible for delivering reliable software components. You will get to be involved in hands-on creation, design, and testing of exciting new features!

Software Engineer

You are a full stack engineer who wants to implement both back-end and front-end software solutions. You will work in an agile team to develop these projects and develop complete systems to better our customer’s experiences!

Test Engineer

You will support the team’s mission to deliver software that meets business needs and allows for a positive customer experience. You will be a key contributor to the overall software delivery team in a fast-paced environment by designing and executing test scenarios that exercise all required test conditions.

Information Security

There are many new and exciting projects that are taking place to protect the integrity of our customer and enterprise data. You will be an integral part of this department!

Skills, Experience and Requirements

Preferred to be currently enrolled in a Bachelor’s degree or Master's degree (non-MBA) program with an expected graduation date between December 2022 and August 2023.

Students who display DISH’s core attributes of Curiosity, Pride, Adventure and Winning

All majors considered, however popular areas of study Include:

Computer Science Computer Engineering Software Engineering Information Systems Information Science Information Technology Systems Engineering Electrical Engineering Security and Risk MIS CIS IST Hardware Engineering Mechanical Engineering Industrial Engineering Informatics

Helpful Skills Include: Java, Python, AWS, Golang, React, Node, SQL, APIs, Android, Javascript, Embedded C

Uncapped Commission:
Benefits

From versatile health perks to new career opportunities, this role provides all the benefits you need to be successful. Check them out on our careers website.

Successful completion of a pre-employment screen, to include a drug test and criminal background check.

Full Job Description
We see boundless potential in the way we live. It drives the way we work. Our culture is our most valuable asset. It acts like a compass for us. We are fast, immersed, humble and bold. And that’s not just words on the walls.

Eliminating time-consuming tasks means people get to do more of what they love. It’s an inspiring, high stakes challenge that motivates us, and this common passion bonds UiPath employees globally. We all strive every day to be better and to accelerate human achievement.

We make software robots, so people don’t have to be robots. Would you like to be part of this journey?

What you would be doing at UiPath:
We are looking for Software Engineer Interns to join our Engineering teams in Bellevue, WA and Brooklyn, NY! As a UiPath intern, you won’t just be working on important projects towards our mission of “a robot for every person”, you’ll also work alongside really good people who insist on giving it their all every day. You will build meaningful and scalable software, participate in brainstorming sessions and share insights to our technology, and work with the product and design teams to understand end-user requirements, formulate use cases, and deliver results. You’ll work and learn from some of the best in industry who are always looking for ways to take it one step further. We value technical and personal growth and during your internship, you will absolutely experience both.

What you’ll bring to UiPath:
A strong fundamental understanding of Computer Science through pursuit of a Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD degree in Computer Science, Math, or a related discipline
Programming proficiency in one or more object-oriented languages (such as C#/C++/Java) backed by solid computer science fundamentals
Experience from previous internships or other multi-person projects, including open-source contributions
Ability to learn unfamiliar systems and form an understanding of those systems, through independent research and working with a mentor and subject matter experts
Life at UiPath can sometimes feel like a roller coaster. It comes with changes, healthy challenges, and the opportunity to build solutions from the ground up, have great impact, and learn a great deal.

At UiPath, we value a range of diverse backgrounds experiences and ideas. We pride ourselves on our diversity and inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, national origin, disability, military and/or veteran status, or any other protected classes.

UiPath is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities. If you have a medical condition or disability which inhibits your ability to complete any part of the application process, and are in need of a reasonable accommodation to complete the process, please contact us @ TALeaders@uipath.com and let us know how we may assist you.

position: Core Data Science Intern, Causality and Privacy Research (PhD)
description:

Facebook is seeking research interns to join the Core Data Science team in the Washington D.C. office. Individuals in this role are expected to be comfortable working as a research scientist, software engineer, and data analyst, and have a passion for solving real-world problems end-to-end through applied research and modeling. An ideal candidate will have a strong research background in either causal inference or statistical data privacy, and will be familiar with modern machine learning and statistics.
Work with a small group of research scientists that consult with business and product teams to execute practical solutions for real-world impact.
Quickly learn and deploy appropriate data science tools and methodologies, with tasks ranging from A/B testing to data analysis to production engineering to optimization and machine learning.
Research and develop new methodologies as needed for complex problems.
Perform and communicate quantitative analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable manner.

Strong programmer in Python
Research experience and publications in at least one of the following areas: causal inference, data privacy, statistics, and machine learning

By providing powerful new ways for people to connect with one another, gain greater access to education, entertainment, medical research, commerce, and much more, our team is empowering millions of customers worldwide.

We're growing rapidly and looking for passionate, innovative professionals to join our team and connect the world to more. You'll work in a collaborative and inclusive environment that values diverse perspectives and continuous learning, and provides industry-leading benefits with unmatched opportunities for career growth. Our team is fearless in pursuit of new ideas and uncompromising in our quest to become the world's first truly global Internet Service Provider. Interested in joining our mission? Job Responsibilities

Are you the type of person that believes in doing the right thing even when there is an easier path to take? Is your personal motto Quality First? If this describes you, you might be a good fit for our Quality Engineering Team!

Review product yield and field reliability data for trends and provide analysis and recommendations to business
Help drive root cause investigations and process improvement efforts as well as create/implement world class quality practices (i.e. Pareto Analysis, Histograms, Cause & Effect Diagrams, Cpk, etc.) and business tools to help streamline this analysis

Help coordinate Corrective Action Requests (CARs) and Failure Analysis Requests (FARs) for improvement Conduct and provide analysis on Gage R&R studies
Collaborate with cross functional teams as you purpose and implement process changes or new solutions

Currently pursuing a degree Bachelor's degree in Industrial Engineering, Computer Science, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or related field
Understanding of Process Improvement tools
Experience with Data Analysis using Python, R, Tableau, Minitab, JMP, and/or Alteryx
Demonstrated ability to distill data-driven insight through informative visualizations & analytical communications
Understanding and theory of Quality Methods, Design of Experiments, and Statistical Process Control methods
Experience in leading projects across multi-functional teams

Preferences

Hands on experience in reliability testing, debugging, failure analysis and functional verification of basic electronics
Experience with experiment design and hypothesis testing

The storage test tools team at Micron Technology is looking for a software engineer intern who would enjoy supporting engineers writing either C++ or python to solve technical issues they are having within their day-to-day development work as well as who may bring new perspective and insight to the team. Your average day will consist of responding to questions from our users, writing storage test programs, triaging, reproducing, and fixing bugs, as well as hands on experience developing C++ and Python modules.

This position is located in Boise, Idaho.
Boise has some of the best whitewater rafting in the country, hundreds of miles of mountain biking trails around town and snow skiing and rock climbing close enough you can go after work. Hunting and fishing possibilities are unlimited in the area, with some nationally known destinations nearby. In addition, Boise hosts many off-Broadway shows and musicals as well as provides numerous shopping and dining opportunities.

Job description

Company Overview

Nomura is a global financial services group with an integrated network spanning over 30 countries. By connecting markets East & West, Nomura services the needs of individuals, institutions, corporates and governments through its three business divisions: Retail, Wholesale (Global Markets and Investment Banking), and Investment Management. Founded in 1925, the firm is built on a tradition of disciplined entrepreneurship, serving clients with creative solutions and considered thought leadership. For further information about Nomura, visit www.nomura.com.

Technology Americas:
The Technology group leverages state of the art information technology and risk management systems. We are developing new applications to implement truly cutting-edge standards and always staying at the forefront of technology and its applications for clients, partners, regulators and suppliers.

Teams within Technology

Global Markets Technology (GMIT) is responsible for developing and managing trading, pricing, analytics, research and sales systems. These systems are used by trading desks across Credit, Rates, FX, Securitized Products, Prime and Equities groups to process trades. Our software is responsible for providing analytics and trading capabilities needed by our traders and clients in a highly complex and dynamic market. Our team has a strong relationship with the trading business and is committed to helping the firm achieve its business goals. The environment provides an ideal place to learn business processes and determine technology solutions to meet the business needs. Depending on the specific role, members of the team interact with technologists, traders or salespeople on a daily basis.

Wholesale Operations Technology (WO IT) covers delivery and support of business applications across Operations and Transaction services. Investment Banking Technology (IBT) is responsible for delivering and managing applications across the Investment Banking division.

Risk and Capital Technology (RCT) provides risk exposure profiling to the Risk Management business. RCT has a global footprint comprised of approximately 300 resources located across London, New York, Mumbai, Hong Kong, and Tokyo. Services and applications include: Market Risk, Credit Risk, and Operational Risk. Additional functions include creating tools to help the Risk business with new product and model validation.

Enterprise Infrastructure Services (EIS) is responsible for maintaining Nomura’s Core Infrastructure IT platforms globally and ensuring operational stability within the environment. Working in close partnership with the Front Office and Support and Control functions, we create and deliver optimal Infrastructure solutions to support the firm’s international business operations.

Data Management Technology (DMT) is the technology service provider to the Global Data Office (GDO) of Nomura Group. DMT works closely with the GDO, the Chief Technology Architecture (CTA) group and the various IT Business Units to build, buy & integrate solutions to catalog and curate data, simplify access to data while also protecting, storing and improving the quality of the data. Through leveraging the latest third party and open source technology, DMT helps Nomura become a data driven organization and in the process reduce cost and increase revenue.

Corporate Technology Services (CTS) is responsible for delivering and supporting business applications to; Finance; Compliance; Human Resources; and the rest of the corporate areas. CTS plays an essential role in servicing the Firm’s business needs and future direction by providing the appropriate solutions and capacity whilst also ensuring the ability of the Firm to report, monitor and supervise this business. Our mission is to provide innovative, cost efficient technology solutions to the Firm to underpin competitiveness, revenue generation and regulatory compliance.

Production Services (WPS and CPS) team maintains software solutions used by the Wholesale Business and Corporate Services globally. The team provides application and systems support across a wide domain including and not limited to Finance, Risk, Equities, Futures & Options, Prime Services including financing, Derivatives, FX, Securitized Products, Operations, Core & Compliance, Infrastructure Tools and Technology Operations and User Helpdesk.

The Global Technology Services (GTS) organization delivers IT Security, and Technology Architecture and Strategic Change Management services to Nomura’s wholesale business. Market Data (MDS) provisions pre and post-trade information that enables users to stay aware of and participate in their markets.

About Our Summer Analyst Program:
The Summer Analyst Program runs for 10 weeks, during which Analysts will enjoy extensive contact with Nomura professionals at all levels through discussion groups, seminars and informal social functions. This program is an integral component of our full time recruiting.

We aim to provide Summer Analysts with the same level of exposure as a first-year Analyst, with a hands-on opportunity to participate as full members of the team. They are expected to form effective working relationships and to demonstrate a commitment to the firm’s goals and values. During the course of the internship, Summer Analysts benefit from working closely with a buddy and interacting regularly with a senior mentor.

What Roles You Might Play:
Developer: Develop, produce and integrate applications that will be used directly by stakeholders. Responsibilities include owning critical components of applications and participating in hands-on development, partnering with QA for unit and integration testing of deliverables and BA colleagues to understand project scope and requirements.
Business Analyst: Act as a liaison between Technology and business clients to define scope and business requirements. Responsibilities include writing detailed functional requirements and use cases, supporting the development team in creating detailed technical specifications, partnering with data providers to ensure model requirements are met, and supporting ongoing user requirements and investigating issues.
Infrastructure: Opportunities include Client Support, System Administrator, Network Operations, Engineering and Project Management in conjunction with our top themes which include, Hybrid Cloud, Supporting the Client Eco System, Digital Workspace, Risk Management Framework, Cyber and Data Security, Utility Services, Virtualization, Project Support and EIS Academy.

Desired Skillset

Outstanding academic qualifications
Familiarity with programming (Java, C#, VBA), computer concepts, and Web technology (HTML/JavaScript/JSP/ASP, Unix Shell/Perl scripting)
Solid fundamental base in logical, analytical data structure; hands on programming, and problem solving
Strong communication and interpersonal relationship skills
Strong organizational and time management skills
Ability to understand financial products
Candidates must be meticulous & ready to take on challenges, as the team deals with mission critical applications.

Requirements

Outstanding academic qualifications; strong GPA
Pursuing a Bachelors or Master’s degree in Computer Science or related fields
Graduating between December 2022 and June 2023

Nomura is an equal opportunity employer.

position: Core Data Science Intern, Computational Social Science (PhD)
description:
Full Job Description
Facebook is looking for researcher Interns to join the Computational Social Science group within the Core Data Science team. Computational Social Science is an interdisciplinary team of quantitative scientists that aims to deliver research and innovation to improve existing products and inform and enable the development of new ones. The team works closely with various product groups throughout Facebook, bringing expertise in algorithms, modeling, machine learning, exploratory data analysis, and social network analysis. We help these teams better understand how people use their products, and we solve hard problems that will enable these products to better serve their users.
Work with large amounts of data in service of concrete conclusions and actionable insights
Comfort manipulating and analyzing complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources
Learn new tools and languages quickly as required by the particular project you are working on, with tasks ranging from data processing to production engineering to modeling and machine learning
Work both independently and collaboratively with other scientists, engineers, designers, UX researchers, and product managers to accomplish complex tasks that deliver demonstrable value to Facebook's community of over 1.7 billion users
Think creatively, proactively, and futuristically to identify new opportunities within Facebook's long-term roadmap for data-scientific contributions
Experience solving analytical problems using quantitative approaches
Comfort manipulating and analyzing complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources
A strong passion for empirical research and for answering hard questions with data
A flexible analytic approach that allows for results at varying levels of precision
Ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable manner
Fluency with at least one scripting language such as Python or PHP
Familiarity with relational databases and SQL
Expert knowledge of an analysis tool such as R, Matlab, or SAS
Experience working with large data sets, experience working with distributed computing tools a plus (Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, etc.)
Must obtain work authorization in country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment
Must be currently enrolled in a full-time degree program and returning to the program after the completion of the internship/co-op
Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining a PhD, in computer science, statistics, economics, sociology or related field
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. position: Intern, IT Transformation Development Program - Charlotte, NC
description:
Full Job Description
Dentsply Sirona is the world’s largest manufacturer of professional dental products and technologies, with a 130-year history of innovation and service to the dental industry and patients worldwide. Dentsply Sirona develops, manufactures, and markets a comprehensive solutions offering including dental and oral health products as well as other consumable medical devices under a strong portfolio of world class brands. Dentsply Sirona’s products provide innovative, high-quality and effective solutions to advance patient care and deliver better and safer dentistry. Dentsply Sirona’s global headquarters is located in Charlotte, North Carolina, USA. The company’s shares are listed in the United States on NASDAQ under the symbol XRAY.

Bringing out the best in people

As advanced as dentistry is today, we are dedicated to making it even better. Our people have a passion for innovation and are committed to applying it to improve dental care. We live and breathe high performance, working as one global team, bringing out the best in each other for the benefit of dental patients, and the professionals who serve them. If you want to grow and develop as a part of a team that is shaping an industry, then we’re looking for the best to join us.

Working at Dentsply Sirona you are able to:
Develop faster - with our commitment to the best professional development.

Perform better - as part of a high-performance, empowering culture.

Shape an industry - with a market leader that continues to drive innovation.

Make a difference -by helping improve oral health worldwide.

Program Details

Our FITT Development Program (FDP) for IT designed specifically to prepare and develop future generations of business leaders within the IT organization. Participants will develop critical leadership & technical skills through rotational assignments within a variety of functional areas. FDP participants will also receive in-depth training and complete a thorough onboarding process. Participants will be assigned a mentor who will provide ongoing coaching and feedback, setting the foundation for success. In addition to hands on learning, you’ll be invited to our intern event series (to learn about Denstply Sirona, Finance, IT, Transofrmation projects, and the overall business) and social activities. At the end of the internship, you will present what you accomplished to senior finance leadership. Candidates will have the opportunity to participate in a paid three month internship in one of our core finance areas:

Corporate Applications

Tech Services and Infrastructure

Cybersecurity

Master Data Management

E-Commerce

CRM

ERP

Most of our full-time hiring is done from our intern program - so take this opportunity to become part of the Dentsply Sirona FDP. Our Program is a 24-month rotational program entered upon graduation, to expose participants to Dentsply Sirona Business Segments across all areas of IT, from Infrastructure and Technology Services to Corporate Business Services. All rotations will provide an excellent learning experience & an opportunity for FDP participants to utilize their leadership skills & technical knowledge to drive incremental value & change.

We look for top caliber students who have exhibited a superior record of achievement both inside and outside the classroom, along with strong interpersonal communication and leadership skills.

Current internships are U.S. based.

Qualifications/ Requirements

Currently pursuing a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business, or related field
Anticipated graduation May 2023 and prepared to start work full time June 2023
Minimum GPA 3.0
Demonstrated leadership experience
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Has interest/ability to work in a dynamic, challenging work environment
Good time management/organization skills with the ability to multi-task
Strong Excel & Powerpoint Skills
Data analytics experience preferred
Project management skills/exposure
Ability to temporarily relocate within the United States for rotational assignments
Must be authorized to work in the US without sponsorship

Dentsply Sirona is an Equal Opportunity/ Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, disability, or protected Veteran status. We appreciate your interest in Dentsply Sirona.

If you need assistance with completing the online application due to a disability, please send an accommodation request to careers@dentsplysirona.com. Please be sure to include “Accommodation Request” in the subject.

position: Stanley Black & Decker - Summer 2022 Technology Internship
description:
Full Job Description
Who We Are
Since 1843, Stanley Black & Decker has set the standard for excellence in everything we do. No company on earth has a stronger or more compelling history of delivering the hardworking, innovative, powerful tools that help professionals around the world build, repair, and protect the world’s most valuable things.

Who is Stanley Black & Decker? We are the leader in tools and security. We are STANLEY Tools. We are DeWalt. We are Mac Tools. We are Porter-Cable. We are the doors that protect you at airports. We are the hydraulic breakers that rescue trapped earthquake survivors. We are the people on the phone in an emergency. No matter where you live, what car you drive, what stores you shop at, or what building you work in, you can bet that we had a hand in making it work.

About Our Internship Program
We are seeking motivated Technology students for our Summer Internship Program. Selected students will participate in a meaningful and challenging 10-week summer internship that will allow each intern to have exposure to different facets of the business and receive critical business skills and career and personal development training. Interns will work on a wide variety of tasks and projects within a cross functional team of professionals and get exposure to leaders within the business.

In these challenging roles…
In these various positions you will have exposure to several areas of Technology at Stanley Black & Decker and will work on a wide variety of tasks and projects with a cross functional team of professionals.

With great rewards…

A utility role interacting with key members of a fortune 500 company
A flexible schedule featuring a max of 40 hours
Opportunity for career advancement upon graduation
Competitive compensation

Work with business users to define and analyze problems and align the most suitable technical, application or configuration solutions.
