Integrity & Accountability – Operate with highest ethical standards. Be who you are, build trusted relationships. Act with transparency and positive intent. Live up to commitments and own the results.

position: Wireless Engineering - UG/MS Corporate Internship Opportunities
description:
Full Job Description
Do you want to change the wireless industry and have exposure with top leaders at DISH Wireless? We are seeking interns to join us in building the next-gen 5G Wireless network. We’re looking at more than your education and previous work experience, we want individuals who are bright, energetic and ambitious. We believe the critical thinking skills you learn in college can be applied across a variety of business functions, regardless of your major. The opportunities at DISH Wireless will provide you with a potential fast track for career advancement. This is what sets us apart as a company.

Our program is designed to give you comprehensive experience in the fast-paced environment of a world class technology company. With hands-on field experience and business projects, you will get an in-depth look at how our business works and where you fit into it.

Interns working within our Wireless space will evaluate current practices and play tangible parts in our business strategy. DISH wireless is building America’s first cloud-native 5G network. It will fundamentally transform the Wireless industry and the way that businesses and consumers communicate.

All opportunities are located in Denver, CO.

Job Duties and Responsibilities:
Electrical engineers, computer engineers, computer scientists, and telecommunications engineer interns work across engineering functions in our Wireless organization to support the design, development, and optimization of our wireless network. As an engineering intern, you will get to work with senior engineers, as well as working cross functionally with different teams, no matter which role you choose!

Cloud or VMWare Engineering Intern

As a Cloud or VMWare Engineering Intern you will research, analyze, test, retest, and troubleshoot problems to help design, evaluate, test, deploy, and optimize DISH’s standalone 5G network.

Majors preferred: MS in Computer Engineering or Computer Science and 3+ years of experience

Data Scientist Intern

As a Data Scientist Intern you will help to solve high-order problems with our data and identify opportunities to exploit data to generate new insight and business value.

Majors preferred: MS in Computer Engineering or Computer Science and 3+ years of experience

Device Engineering Intern

As a Device Engineering Intern, you will help to generate and maintain performance and functional requirements for the first standalone 5G broadband network in the US’s compliance and certification.

Majors preferred: BS or MS in Electrical Engineering

Network Engineering Intern or Network Security Engineering Intern

As a Network Engineering Intern or Network Security Engineering Intern you will use knowledge of IP networks to optizmie complex LAN/WAN/RAN and Firewall configurations.

Majors preferred: BS in Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering and Network security certifications and cloud experience are pluses!

RF Optimization and Design Engineering Intern

As an RF Optimization and Design Engineering Intern you will perform design activities related to building the first standalone 5G broadband network in the US.

Majors preferred: BS or MS in Electrical Engineering

Wireless Core Engineering Intern

As a Wireless Core Engineering Intern you will focus on the deployment of our 5G core powered by Nokia and Mavenir. You will be part of an operational team working in a live production environment.

Majors preferred: MS in Computer Engineering or Telecommunications Engineering and 3+ years of experience

Skills, Experience and Requirements

Preferred to be currently enrolled in a Bachelor’s degree or Master's degree (non-MBA) program with an expected graduation date between December 2022 and August 2023.

Students who display DISH’s core attributes of Curiosity, Pride, Adventure and Winning.

Uncapped Commission:
Benefits

From versatile health perks to new career opportunities, this role provides all the benefits you need to be successful. Check them out on our careers website.

Successful completion of a pre-employment screen, to include a drug test and criminal background check.

Full Job Description
Bigger challenges. Bolder ideas. Global impact. At Viasat, we're on a mission to deliver connections with the capacity to change the world. We're the company behind the world's fastest satellite internet service, with technology that's helping to bridge the digital divide and improve life for our customers around the globe. By providing powerful new ways for people to connect with one another, gain greater access to education, entertainment, medical research, commerce, and much more, our team is empowering millions of customers worldwide.

We're growing rapidly and looking for passionate, innovative professionals to join our team and connect the world to more. You'll work in a collaborative and inclusive environment that values diverse perspectives and continuous learning, and provides industry-leading benefits with unmatched opportunities for career growth. Our team is fearless in pursuit of new ideas and uncompromising in our quest to become the world's first truly global Internet Service Provider. Interested in joining our mission? Take a look at career opportunities at Viasat today.

As an intern of Operations Process + Technology group, you will work closely with Operations, Quality, IT, Engineering, and Business unit functions to develop and implement the process and system improvements to enhance business performance. Our team is currently redefining supply chain planning processes across Viasat. We drive change in Supply Chain and Operations Planning by reducing cost, increasing visibility of Supply/Demand and Driving transformational KPIs.

Our ideal candidate has a can-do attitude, strong problem-solving skills, is a keen listener and has the ability to visualize not what is, but what can be. A successful intern for our group will be able to quickly understand the specific business needs of Viasat, and possess the influence needed to gain consensus and drive improvement. They will be skilled at multi-tasking, and driving results in the near term, while simultaneously positioning the business processes to scale effectively with projected company growth in the future.

Currently pursuing a Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, Management Information System, Industrial Engineering, or a related field
Knowledge of Supply Chain and Operations functions
Capable of applying resourceful and creative thought processes to resolve complex problems

Ability to multi-task and adjust priorities based on workload and direction from management and/or customers
Adept at influencing cross functionally, developing consensus, and moving the business forward
Strong skills utilizing standard Microsoft tools such as Excel, Access, Word, Visio, SharePoint, Project, and Power Point

Experience or coursework related to Supply Chain, Industrial Engineering, simulation, modeling, and statistics
Exposure to Core Inventory and Operations Management concepts

Full Job Description
  • (3168367)
The Research Machine Learning (ML) Co-op master’s level student will assist the Principal Investigator with health information technology (HIT) research studies. Current projects underway include but are not limited to: 1. developing an innovative allergy reconciliation module within the electronic health record (EHR) and redesigning drug allergy alerting mechanisms using big data analytics and up-to-date evidence; 2. leveraging advanced informatics and longitudinal EHR data to identify severe cutaneous adverse reactions (SCAR) cases to study genetic and epidemiological risk factors for SCAR related to commonly used drugs such as antibiotics; 3. investigating, characterizing and annotating adverse drug events (ADEs) documented in ambulatory care clinical notes and to assess the ability of NLP and machine learning to identify ADEs. The ML Co-op may also assist with reporting and dissemination of findings including manuscript preparation.

Principal Duties and Responsibilities:
Contribute to the design, development and implementation of the proposed system/application.

Perform system development and quality assurance testing (e.g., generating testing cases and identifying system errors).

Conduct comprehensive analyses of a large amount of clinical data.

Use natural language processing, data mining and machine learning skills.

Data collection, data analysis and system evaluation.

Prepare talks and presentation materials including PowerPoint slides, tables and graphs.

Prepare meeting documentation, grant proposals, research reports, and manuscripts for publication in scientific journals.

Assist with evaluation activities including development of surveys/tools, data collection and analysis.

Must be well-organized and systematic in work process

Performs other duties as assigned.

Enrolled in a Masters’ program in the field of biomedical informatics, computational linguistics, big data science, or computer science, and an interest in the use of technology to support clinical care.
At least 1+ years of relevant background or coursework in machine learning
Proficiency in Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, Excel, and database software (SQL).
Competency in Python and NLP is preferred.
Familiarity with biostatistics concepts preferred.
Strong grasp or understanding of clinical settings, and development, implementation and support of clinical information systems
Experience working with healthcare IT usability and evaluation a plus
Experience in medical informatics research a plus
Excellent judgment and ability to interpret and follow study’s requirements, including IRB

Skills/Abilities/Competencies Required:
Enrolled in a Masters’ program in the field of biomedical informatics, computational linguistics, big data science, or computer science, and an interest in the use of technology to support clinical care.
At least 1+ years of relevant background or coursework in machine learning
Competency in SQL and database management.
Competency in Python preferred.
Familiarity with natural language processing, big data algorithms, or machine learning algorithms preferred.
Familiarity with biostatistics concepts preferred.
Organizational skills and ability to prioritize tasks in order to meet deadlines.
Ability to demonstrate professionalism and respect.
Regard for patient privacy essential.
Strong attention to detail with the ability and willingness to ask clarifying questions.
Ability to work independently with only general supervision and in collaborative group environment.
Ability to be flexible, versatile and adaptable in day-to-day activities conducted in a multi-site environment.

description:

Position Summary...

Enhances the network security infrastructure by monitoring network performance via available network tools; writing change control installation plans; assisting in transforming customer needs into security solutions that deliver business value while improving security; installing network security infrastructure; assisting team members with changes; leading suppliers and team members in reviewing system performance; identifying and recommending improvements to network alerts and monitors; recommending, documenting, and implementing improvements; assisting in network security design; engaging suppliers to drive security solutions for the business; assessing potential network security issues and identifying solutions; and conducting audits on network rules, alerts, and monitors on a scheduled basis.

Develops and implements security system designs and products that have high availability and scalability consistent with company needs by assisting Technical Experts and Senior Systems Engineers in setting technical direction; contributing to technology roadmaps; gathering and developing requirements to support new security system implementations; evaluating supplier products; making recommendations relative to security products and services; understanding the relationship between departmental standards and technical decisions; researching and presenting information about new technologies; developing design references; participating in design reviews; and ensuring compliance with information technology governance standards.

Leads resolution of security system issues (for example, configuration and management of security systems, spam filtering, access management) by troubleshooting and diagnosing issues through root cause analysis; identifying trends and taking corrective action to address performance problems; creating reports and actionable metrics for security system products; supporting large-scale, cross-department production issues; resolving support problems in a timely manner; providing updates to customers, project leads, and management team on problem resolution status; and driving supplier participation during problem resolution.

Manages project deliverables by delivering assigned tasks; delegating tasks as appropriate; ensuring the completion of assigned tasks; managing groups of tasks associated with large initiatives; completing and reviewing documentation in accordance with established guidelines; sharing knowledge and best practices with team members; participating in and leading meetings; and communicating tasks to stakeholders (for example, customers, leadership, peers, third-party providers) as appropriate.

Demonstrates up-to-date expertise and applies this to the development, execution, and improvement of action plans by providing expert advice and guidance to others in the application of information and best practices; supporting and aligning efforts to meet customer and business needs; and building commitment for perspectives and rationales.

Provides and supports the implementation of business solutions by building relationships and partnerships with key stakeholders; identifying business needs; determining and carrying out necessary processes and practices; monitoring progress and results; recognizing and capitalizing on improvement opportunities; and adapting to competing demands, organizational changes, and new responsibilities.

Full Job Description
Bigger challenges. Bolder ideas. Global impact. At Viasat, we're on a mission to deliver connections with the capacity to change the world. We're the company behind the world's fastest satellite internet service, with technology that's helping to bridge the digital divide and improve life for our customers around the globe. By providing powerful new ways for people to connect with one another, gain greater access to education, entertainment, medical research, commerce, and much more, our team is empowering millions of customers worldwide.

We're looking for passionate, innovative professionals to join our team and connect the world to more. You'll work in a collaborative and inclusive environment that values diverse perspectives and continuous learning, and provides industry-leading benefits with unmatched opportunities for career growth. Our team is fearless in pursuit of new ideas and uncompromising in our quest to become the world's first truly global Internet Service Provider. Interested in joining our mission? Take a look at career opportunities at Viasat today.

Educational focus on digital signal processing (DSP), communication theory, digital logic design, and/or systems engineering
Experience or desire to learn Matlab/Simulink for modeling, simulation, and design

Full Job Description

WHO WE ARE:

We’re a close, motivated team on a big mission to change trajectories for future leaders in the finance sector. We have a vision of a world where all finance leaders steward the world’s capital for the greater good. And our mission is to inspire character and integrity in the finance leaders of tomorrow.

Scholars of Finance is a national team, with 540+ members across 17 universities in New York, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Minneapolis, and several other markets. Since starting less than a year ago, we’ve raised more than $1M+ in seed funding and commitments and brought together 1200+ students with 400+ executives for values-based leadership development. We’re proud to be supported by partners including Goldman Sachs, U.S. Bank, and Piper Sandler, and advisors including Richard Davis, prior CEO of U.S. Bank, Teri List, Board Director of Microsoft, and Tony Paquette, CFO of Point72.

Your Opportunity:

  • Expert Mentorship. Morgan Stanley--a partner of SOF--has committed to providing one-on-one mentorship to our Software Engineering Interns for 3-5 hours per week. Mentors are all 10-15 year veteran Technologists on staff at Morgan Stanley.
  • Get Practical Experience. This internship is designed to give you experience building real web applications using bleeding-edge low/no-code systems such as AirTable, Softr.io, Zapier, and others. You’ll build something you’re proud of, and the skills you’ve gained will be highly valuable. You’ll also gain valuable experience talking to users and making our product better every day.
  • Grow as a Leader. Spend several hours per month investing in your own leadership development and career planning. Our Executive Team has mentored high-potential young professionals for many years and will work with you to achieve your personal and professional development goals.
  • Solve Exciting Problems. Internships with SOF are massive opportunities to work on strategic projects that will meaningfully influence the future of our organization. We are scaling 5 core programs from 20 to 200 universities in the years ahead. This is an opportunity to build the technology stack and infrastructure that supports our growth.

As a Software Engineering Intern, You Will:

  • Develop our web application that is the ‘logged in’ experience for members of Scholars of Finance
  • Build new integrations between databases using API, SaaS, AirTable and Zapier
  • Enhance processes that allow all members of Scholars of Finance to easily view and update any important information
  • Enhance the User Experience (UX) through user interviews and feedback review
  • Build and design systems for program and community management to support rapid growth for the organization
  • Capture key impact data to iterate and innovate on our programs and products

What You’ll Need:

Foundational Skills

  • 1-2 previous internships or 1-2 years of general work experience.
  • You have knowledge of database architecture and understand at least 1 coding language
  • Researching, developing, and launching new products & programs.
  • Strong critical thinking skills; you can identify opportunities, anticipate challenges and gaps, and contingency plan accordingly.
  • one of college at an accredited university pursuing a degree in Computer Science or a related major.
  • Prior experience developing websites, web apps, or CMS systems.
  • You can effectively recommend strategies, tactics, timelines, and resources needed to achieve organizational goals.
  • You can work independently and take ownership of outcomes while prioritizing and juggling multiple projects in a deadline-driven environment.

Mentality for Success

  • You have a passion for our mission, an interest in finance as a force for good, and a commitment to developing ethical & morally sound leaders.
  • Unwavering commitment to quality programs and data-driven program evaluation.
  • A desire and willingness to contribute beyond your job description. You’re ready to do whatever it takes to push the mission forward.
  • Humility to be both a leader and a “do-er”. After building a strategy, you’ll roll up your sleeves and do whatever it takes to get it done. Everyone--even the COO--monitors the shared box and replies to tickets.
  • Courage to challenge the status quo when logic and reason require it. Is something broken? Fix it.

Nice-to-Have Experience

  • Working within, leading, and growing small & nimble start-up teams.
  • Familiar with AirTable and Zapier/Integromat
  • Strong experience with Google Sheets or Microsoft Excel and advanced knowledge of Sheets/Excel formulas.
  • Ability to manipulate data in an easy to understand format.
  • Working with teams in multiple cities & multiple time zones.
  • Fluency in several programming languages; you’ve been a growth hacker in the past and can build anything from nothing.

Benefits and Perks:

  • Gain Unparalleled Experience. Scholars of Finance started with one leadership symposium and now we’re on a mission to change the future of the finance sector. Our Software Engineering Interns partner with Technologists at Morgan Stanley and SOF's Chief Operating Officer to grow exponentially.
  • Build a Movement. Scholars of Finance has early traction, like our partnership with Goldman Sachs or our programs that attract hundreds of students and finance leaders every year. You will help recruit and build a national organization from the ground up.
  • Work On What Matters. Scholars of Finance wants you to take the initiative to do what you are passionate about. If you have a big idea, we want you to run with it, and we’ll help you bring it to life.
  • Gain Academic Credit. If you would like to apply this internship toward academic credit, Scholars of Finance will fully support you in obtaining credit from your university.

Your Commitment:

  • Program Length. We are flexible on when you start, how long the internship runs, and what hours you are expected to work. Generally, we are seeking candidates who can commit at least 3 months to an internship.
  • Participation. It is required to participate for at least 15 hours per week with 5+ of these hours between 9 am and 6 pm EST M-F so that it’s possible to sync with team members.
  • Pay. This is an unpaid internship. We offer an educational stipend of $200/month ($600 total), but this funding is not considered pay and is not tied to merit or performance. Aside from monetary compensation, you’ll also have world-class personal development and growth opportunities as outlined above, executive exposure with our Board of Directors and Advisors, and the ability to design elements of your own internship experience.
  • Location. Our entire team works remotely, so whether you’re at home, on campus, or in Europe for the month, you can work wherever you want.

Don't spend too much time on it, it should be quick and easy just to give us an idea of your background in Computer Science and why you would be a good fit. Our Company:
ObjectSecurity is a small company in downtown San Diego (we work out of a coworking space but are currently virtual). We have traditionally focused on cybersecurity but have branched out into data analytics and AI in recent years. Our award-winning, patented security product is OpenPMF, which uses cool models and algorithms to make it easier to author and maintain fine-grained, dynamic access control policies.
We are doing exciting other product developments, including a supply chain risks analysis product which takes an SAP data dump and turns it into a graph DB, and then runs analytics over it to identify risks. Another cool project is an "AI hacker" development, which uses AI to simulate a hacker.
Java Analytics Position:
We are looking for an intern to create new analytics for our SCRAMS product for gathering data from and analyzing various data sources. Additionally, we are also looking for interns who have experience with Natural Language Processing to work on more advanced assessments.
We are looking for interns for both during the semester and during the summer. We are flexible with start and end dates of the internship and how many hours interns work per week.
This is the initial internship project, but depending on how long it takes to complete, there is always room to grow with our company and move on to other projects. There’s also scope for moving into other projects in the fields of machine learning, AI, information modeling, analytics, cybersecurity and more. The sky is the limit with our company.

Full Job Description
Job Summary: Cole Engineering Services is seeking a highly motivated candidate to support activities for an emerging simulation and training capability for the United States Army. The candidate will support test and evaluation activities to include development of test procedures, supporting the execution of test and evaluation events, and performing hardware and software analysis and troubleshooting across complex military systems.

Essential Job Functions:
Candidates will support the design, creation and execution of hardware/software test cases, scenarios, and procedures that incorporates the use of a variety of software applications and tools.
Assists in defining integration and testing processes and procedures.
Performs unit testing, configuration item and system level tests, and supports verification/validation testing as required.
Develops test plans and test reports for all levels of testing performed.
Works closely with the leads, development staff and systems engineers to thoroughly understand the system requirements and hardware/software implementation.
Works closely with leadership to identify and define testing strategies and plan resources to ensure adequate assets are in place for all testing activities.
Analyzes test results, metrics and trends and provides feedback to development and systems engineers.

Required Education/Experience:
Currently seeking Bachelor’s or Graduate coursework in a related technical discipline such as mechanical engineering, electrical engineering, industrial engineering, computer science, information technology, systems or software engineering from an accredited college or university.
Position is year-round. Hours are flexible based on coursework and academic commitments.

Knowledge in any of the following areas would be considered a plus:

Hardware troubleshooting and fault diagnosis.
Knowledge and experience of testing methodologies and analyzing results from small-scale unit testing to large-scale system testing.
Knowledge/experience with Industry best-practice software development and collaboration tools such as JIRA and Confluence.
Experience operating in a collaborative work environment.

Other Requirements: Please note that pursuant to a government contract, this specific position requires U. S. Citizenship status with ability to obtain a SECRET security clearance.

This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee. The above is intended to describe the general contents of and requirements for the performance of this job.

Our Company:
ObjectSecurity is a small company in downtown San Diego (we work out of a coworking space but are currently virtual). We have traditionally focused on cybersecurity but have branched out into data analytics and AI in recent years. Our award-winning, patented security product is OpenPMF, which uses cool models and algorithms to make it easier to author and maintain fine-grained, dynamic access control policies.

We are doing exciting other product developments, including a supply chain risks analysis product which takes an SAP data dump and turns it into a graph DB, and then runs analytics over it to identify risks. Another cool project is an "AI hacker" development, which uses AI to simulate a hacker.
Front-End Position:
We are looking for an intern with experience working on websites who can improve the results section of our easySCRAMS product by taking the data returned from the backend and creating various charts, tables and graphs so users can better analyze their results.
We are looking for interns for both during the semester and during the summer. We are flexible with start and end dates of the internship and how many hours interns work per week.
Qualifications:
1) Prior experience with PHP, HTML, JS, CS and Bootstrap
2) Available 8-16 hours per week virtually
3) Past experience working with JSON objects in JavaScript
4) Recommended, but not mandatory: Experience with APIs, ChartJS, creating charts, tables and graphs in HTML, Bootstrap and JS
Learning Objectives:
By working directly on software engineering projects hands-on doing front-end and back-end or working on embedded systems, hardware and/or microelectronics, interns will gain valuable experience in the software engineering field and improve upon their computer science skills as evidenced through their weekly projects.
Expectations:
1) Weekdays and hours worked are flexible based on the student's schedule but should be communicated to supervisor at the beginning of each week.
2) We will communicate with the intern virtually via email, Slack and Zoom. A supervisor will meet with the intern at the start of the day to go over the day's tasks and
3) Materials will be provided to interns at the beginning of the day. All interns are expected to push their code at the end of each work day to GitHub
4) If interns are stuck or run into an issue with their code, they are encouraged to reach out to their supervisor, since someone will almost always be available to help.

How do you want to spend your next summer vacation? If you want to spend your time working with a motivated team of software engineers who are dedicated to mentoring and nurturing the next generation of gifted developers, look no further than Expedition Technology in Herndon, VA!

We are seeking summer interns with an interest in pursuing a career in Software Engineering for the summer of 2022. All positions are full-time temporary and are paid at a competitive hourly rate. All interns will work onsite at our company headquarters in Herndon, Virginia and will work side by side with experienced software engineering mentors.

Our summer interns work on real programs and real problems. Interns' work is integral to our overall program goals and gives them the experience of working on an Agile-based software development team, using version control methods, provides an introduction to the Scrum process and more. There will be opportunity to provide specific input into the software components of the system, including hardware/software trade offs, database design, software reuse, as well as requirements analysis and synthesis.

The work is full-stack development and could include developing storefronts, incorporating custom machine learning models and writing code to develop full-stack software programs in a cloud-based and/or near real-time environment.

Current student pursuing a Bachelor’s degree or Master's degree in computer science, computer engineering or a related discipline
Self-starter attitude and willingness to work on problems that don't always have a clearly-defined solution
Undergraduate or graduate students graduating in December 2022 and/or May 2023 will be given preference

We are proud that our dynamic and collaborative culture along with our generous benefits package allowed us to earn a spot on the 2019, 2020 and 2021 Washington Business Journal's Best Places to Work List. We also earned recognition as a Top Workplace by The Washington Post and are one of the 75 Fastest Growing Privately-owned tech companies in the the Washington DC metro area.

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer that believes a diverse range of talent creates an environment that fuels creativity and innovation. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, national origin, genetic information or protected veteran status.

Full Job Description
Pison is creating the next generation of neural interfaces that focus on gesture recognition and neurophysiological insights. Pison leverages our patented electroneurography (ENG) platform to translate data generated from our body's natural physiological electricity stemming at the brain into machine interpretable events in software. This allows for never before seen intuitive control of any experience in the IoT universe and discovery of neurological correlations drawn from our proprietary AI and data sets. Pison's government, Department of Defense and Fortune 100 customers have a deep pipeline of pending projects fueling our growth. Pison's long term vision is to own the platform which translates human intention to machine-readable code.

As an IT intern you will support the day-to-day IT functions at a tech start-up, managing IP assets and provide tech support for your colleagues. You will contribute to our success and growth from day one, whilst learning from the Director of Information Security and IT on best practices, strategies and management of an IT department.

****Must be a US citizen to qualify due to US Government contracts****

This position is located in our Boston, MA office. For the safety of our employees, we are currently working remotely and will return to the office when it is safe to do so.

The Role

Day-to-Day Google cloud infrastructure management.
Manage company IP assets, working with People Operations, Finance and more to ensure new employees have all equipment needed for success and all inventory movement is tracked
Build the inventory tracking infrastructure and process for ASGARD applications.
Troubleshoot DEVSECOPS operations and projects
Support the physical & cybersecurity infrastructure work for Pison.
Manage Drone and Robot resources.

About You

Computer Science Major
Previous internship/co-op experience
Google Cloud knowledge
Experience working with both Windows and Mac products.
Scripting experience in an academic or professional environment.
Solution focused and comfortable with working autonomously to solve problems.
Service minded and happy to help Pison colleagues with troubleshooting
Excited about a start-up and emerging technologies.

We understand that candidates can feel discouraged if they do not tick every box. We encourage you to apply. Pison is building a diverse team with people from all backgrounds who can help us build an inclusive organization.

position: Spring 2022: Sensor Modeling & Autonomous Driving Simulation Intern
description:
Full Job Description
The Motional global headquarters are located at 100 Northern Avenue in Boston, MA. Nestled in the busting Seaport district with sweeping views of Boston Harbor and downtown Boston, the offices are located close to major transit lines and a quick walk to various restaurants and popular attractions.

Sensor Modeling & Autonomous Driving Simulation Intern

We're seeking a highly motivated candidate with a background in robotics and perception systems and solid programming skills to help us build the future of autonomous driving. This role will be in the autonomy systems engineering team and will collaborate with the machine learning and component engineering teams. You'll be building state-of-the-art sensor simulation models for the camera, lidar, and radar systems and use them to define metrics for machine learning perception algorithms. You'll have the opportunity to collaborate with an exceptional team of researchers, engineers, and tech leads to make a tangible impact on the future of autonomous driving.

What you'll be doing:
Building analytical sensor models and improving existing models using the first principals
Developing numerical sensor models using the analytical formulations and frameworks
Verification and validation of models using test data logs and updating models accordingly
Coupling sensor models with commercial dynamic graphical simulation engines and creating complex scenarios
Derive requirements and metrics for our in-house ML-based perception algorithms based on parametric sensor simulation studies
Collaborate an interdisciplinary team of machine learning engineers, sensor specialists, and software engineers

What we're looking for:
We're looking for someone who is driven, is a builder, has a get-things-done mentality, and can work effectively in a team setting. You should have most of these items in your resume:
A bachelor or master's degree in mechanical, electrical, or computer science with a solid understanding of analytical and numerical modeling of physical systems
Fluent in Python and comfortable with MATLAB
Familiar with Object-oriented programming and ability to write clean and reusable codes
Experience with software development standard practices and ability to build scalable products

Bonus points:
Knowledge of software front-end and back-end technologies and ability to build software prototypes
A general understanding of machine-learning and perception algorithms
Exposure to simulation software and running parametric studies
Experience with lidar, camera, radar, microphone, and thermal imaging systems

Why you should join us

Our team is commercializing a world-class driverless system. The Motional team is behind some of the industry's largest leaps forward in the last decade, including the first fully-autonomous cross-country drive in the U.S, the launch of the world's first robotaxi pilot, and operation of the world's most-established public robotaxi fleet. Strategically formed by Hyundai Motor Group and Aptiv, Motional is fundamentally changing how people move through their lives.

Motional is making driverless vehicles a safe, reliable, and accessible reality.
Our team is commercializing a world-class driverless system. The Motional team is behind some of the industry's largest leaps forward in the last decade, including the first fully-autonomous cross-country drive in the U.S, the launch of the world's first robotaxi pilot, and operation of the world's most-established public robotaxi fleet. Strategically formed by Hyundai Motor Group and Aptiv, Motional is fundamentally changing how people move through their lives.

Headquartered in Boston, Motional has operations in the US and Asia. For more information, visit www.Motional.com and follow us on Twitter, LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram and YouTube.

Motional AD Inc. is an EOE. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. To comply with Federal Law, we participate in E-Verify. All newly-hired employees are queried through this electronic system established by the DHS and the SSA to verify their identity and employment eligibility.

Don't spend too much time on it, it should be quick and easy just to give us an idea of your background in Computer Science and why you would be a good fit. The link to Part 1 of the Google Form application can be found at https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSf7WpHoW3P1j0TGSlN0q11Xy0pCAOEuR9lXiiBNCvyy1B3SwQ/viewform . Please fill out the form to be considered for the position.

Our Company:
ObjectSecurity is a small company in downtown San Diego (we work out of a coworking space but are currently virtual). We have traditionally focused on cybersecurity but have branched out into data analytics and AI in recent years. Our award-winning, patented security product is OpenPMF, which uses cool models and algorithms to make it easier to author and maintain fine-grained, dynamic access control policies.
We are doing exciting other product developments, including a supply chain risks analysis product which takes an SAP data dump and turns it into a graph DB, and then runs analytics over it to identify risks. Another cool project is an "AI hacker" development, which uses AI to simulate a hacker.

Reverse Engineering Position:
We are looking for an intern with experience working on dynamically analyzing binaries using various tools. We currently have a contract with the Navy to analyze binaries on embedded systems. In part 2 of the application, please list tools that you have used in the past and your prior work.
We are looking for interns for both during the semester and during the summer. We are flexible with start and end dates of the internship and how many hours interns work per week.

Qualifications:
1) Available 8-16 hours per week virtually
2) Prior experience with reverse engineering, using various tools to analyze binaries, and/or extracting firmware off of a device either with an internship/job, from classes, a prior internship or from a research project.

Learning Objectives:
By working directly on software engineering projects hands-on doing front-end and back-end or working on embedded systems, hardware and/or microelectronics, interns will gain valuable experience in the software engineering field and improve upon their computer science skills as evidenced through their weekly projects.

Expectations:
1) Weekdays and hours worked are flexible based on the student's schedule but should be communicated to supervisor at the beginning of each week.
2) We will communicate with the intern virtually via email, Slack and Zoom. A supervisor will meet with the intern at the start of the day to go over the day's tasks and
3) Materials will be provided to interns at the beginning of the day. All interns are expected to push their code at the end of each work day to GitHub
4) If interns are stuck or run into an issue with their code, they are encouraged to reach out to their supervisor, since someone will almost always be available to help.

Job Types: Part-time, Internship

Pay: From $14.00 per hour

COVID-19 considerations:
All of our positions are currently virtual.

  • Fully Remote

FLIT is a digital sustainable investing platform designed to grow your wealth while making an impact. Tell us your financial goals (e.g., buying a home, planning for retirement) and causes you care about (e.g., climate change, gender, and racial equality). FLIT will carefully construct a personalized portfolio to align your values with your desired impact. In addition to providing sustainable investing solutions, we strive to promote financial literacy. It is a core value of our team and is a cornerstone of our process to make investing easy and inclusive.

To learn more, visit https://www.flitinvest.com.

Role summary

We are currently looking for a fall intern to support our software development team. We are looking for motivated individuals with a background and interest in iOS development. We are especially interested in candidates with studies or experience in developing early-stage mobile applications. As part of your internship program, you will learn about the lifecycle of bringing a product to market while being part of an energetic and diverse team. You will also gain first-hand experience in a FinTech environment with the opportunity to learn about sustainability and finance. Our internship program runs during the fall semester. The opportunity can be part-time/full-time, depending on the candidate’s school schedule and availability. After the initial training period, you will receive 2 personalized projects that you will lead for the remaining of the internship.

position: Fall 2021: Sensor Modeling & Autonomous Driving Simulation Intern
description:
Full Job Description
The Motional global headquarters are located at 100 Northern Avenue in Boston, MA. Nestled in the busting Seaport district with sweeping views of Boston Harbor and downtown Boston, the offices are located close to major transit lines and a quick walk to various restaurants and popular attractions.

Sensor Modeling & Autonomous Driving Simulation Intern

We're seeking a highly motivated candidate with a background in robotics and perception systems and solid programming skills to help us build the future of autonomous driving. This role will be in the autonomy systems engineering team and will collaborate with the machine learning and component engineering teams. You'll be building state-of-the-art sensor simulation models for the camera, lidar, and radar systems and use them to define metrics for machine learning perception algorithms. You'll have the opportunity to collaborate with an exceptional team of researchers, engineers, and tech leads to make a tangible impact on the future of autonomous driving.

What you'll be doing:
Building analytical sensor models and improving existing models using the first principals
Developing numerical sensor models using the analytical formulations and frameworks
Verification and validation of models using test data logs and updating models accordingly
Coupling sensor models with commercial dynamic graphical simulation engines and creating complex scenarios
Derive requirements and metrics for our in-house ML-based perception algorithms based on parametric sensor simulation studies
Collaborate an interdisciplinary team of machine learning engineers, sensor specialists, and software engineers

What we're looking for:
We're looking for someone who is driven, is a builder, has a get-things-done mentality, and can work effectively in a team setting. You should have most of these items in your resume:
A bachelor or master's degree in mechanical, electrical, or computer science with a solid understanding of analytical and numerical modeling of physical systems
Fluent in Python and comfortable with MATLAB
Familiar with Object-oriented programming and ability to write clean and reusable codes
Experience with software development standard practices and ability to build scalable products

Bonus points:
Knowledge of software front-end and back-end technologies and ability to build software prototypes
A general understanding of machine-learning and perception algorithms
Exposure to simulation software and running parametric studies
Experience with lidar, camera, radar, microphone, and thermal imaging systems

Why you should join us

Our team is commercializing a world-class driverless system. The Motional team is behind some of the industry's largest leaps forward in the last decade, including the first fully-autonomous cross-country drive in the U.S, the launch of the world's first robotaxi pilot, and operation of the world's most-established public robotaxi fleet. Strategically formed by Hyundai Motor Group and Aptiv, Motional is fundamentally changing how people move through their lives.

Motional is making driverless vehicles a safe, reliable, and accessible reality.
Our team is commercializing a world-class driverless system. The Motional team is behind some of the industry's largest leaps forward in the last decade, including the first fully-autonomous cross-country drive in the U.S, the launch of the world's first robotaxi pilot, and operation of the world's most-established public robotaxi fleet. Strategically formed by Hyundai Motor Group and Aptiv, Motional is fundamentally changing how people move through their lives.

Headquartered in Boston, Motional has operations in the US and Asia. For more information, visit www.Motional.com and follow us on Twitter, LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram and YouTube.

Motional AD Inc. is an EOE. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. To comply with Federal Law, we participate in E-Verify. All newly-hired employees are queried through this electronic system established by the DHS and the SSA to verify their identity and employment eligibility.

Full Job Description

At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work — and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.

Northrop Grumman is seeking a Software Engineer Intern. This position will be located at our Aeronautics Systems Sector in Redondo Beach, CA. The qualified candidate will become part of Northrop Grumman's Palmdale Aircraft Integration Center of Excellence organization.Essential Functions: The selected candidate will perform technical planning, system integration, verification and validation, cost and risk, and supportability and effectiveness analyses for total systems. Other duties include:
Performs a variety of duties in the electronic, mechanical, electromechanical, or optical areas.
Constructs, troubleshoots, calibrates, adjusts, tests, and maintains equipment, components, devices, or systems.
Works from engineering drawings and written or verbal instructions. Operates related equipment; conducts tests and reports data in prescribed format.
Performs calibration and alignment checks; makes adjustments, modifications, and replacements as directed; prepares prescribed compounds and solutions.
Exclude technicians working in Production or Quality Assurance
Basic Qualifications for a Software Engineer Intern (K001): A candidate, regardless of age and hiring source, must meet ALL of the below criteria. The candidate must:
Be enrolled full-time and pursuing an undergraduate or graduate degree from an accredited college/university AND graduating after August 2022
Be majoring in or having majored in a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering or Math) degree.
Have an overall cumulative GPA of 3.0/4.0 or higher (unofficial academic transcripts must be provided at time of application by uploading the documents to your application or profile)
Be available to work full-time (40 hours per week) for at least 10 weeks during summer 2022
Be able to obtain and maintain a U.S. Government security clearance (U.S. citizenship is a pre-requisite)

Preferred Qualifications:
Have an overall cumulative GPA of 3.25/4.0 or higher
Previous internship/co-op or other work experience, leadership & teamwork capabilities, interpersonal communication skills, and activities (professional/community/extracurricular)

Pay Range:
Undergraduate degrees (Including graduating students planning on attending/enrolled in a full-time Master’s program): $24.00 to $29.75 per hour
Master’s: $35.25 to $37.50 per hour
At Northrop Grumman, our internship pay rates are standardized and take into account three main factors: the anticipated graduation date of the individual, the cost of labor of the geographic location, and whether the internship is considered technical or administrative.

Salary Range: 24 - 29.75
Salary Range 2: 35.25 - 37.5

Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results. Employees in Vice President or Director positions may be eligible for Long Term Incentives. In addition, Northrop Grumman provides a variety of benefits including health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, Company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) for vacation and/or personal business.

Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit http://www.northropgrumman.com/EEO. U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

Full Job Description
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

Internships at TikTok aim to provide students the chance to work with our clients and teams to address key business problems and identify areas of growth for the company. With your education and experience, you will be able to take on real-world challenges from day one.

By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Mountain View, CA, San Francisco, CA and Bellevue, WA. This Internship Program is for 12 weeks duration beginning in May/June 2022.

Application deadline: February 15th, 2022
Candidates can apply to a maximum of two positions and will be considered for jobs in the order you apply. The application limit is firm and includes all campus globally. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis and we encourage you to apply early.

Teams:
  • General Information Platform
Responsibilities
This internship provides students the opportunity to join one of our engineering teams where you will have the opportunity to:
  • Build new features that touch hundreds of millions of people around the world
  • Solve unique, large-scale, highly complex technical problems
  • Code high quality features on Android or iOS using Java, Kotlin, Objective-C, or Swift
  • Partner with PMs, designers, engineers from different teams on building new features on mobile application
  • Participate in technical discussions related to team's product and engineering work
  • Currently pursuing a PhD degree in Computer Science or a related field
  • Able to commit to working for 12 weeks during Summer 2022
  • Experience with Objective-C, Swift, Java, Kotlin, Golang, Python, or C++
  • Must obtain work authorization in country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment
Preferred Qualifications
  • Intent to return to degree-program after the completion of the internship
  • Demonstrated software engineering experience from previous internship, work experience, coding competitions, or publications
  • High levels of creativity and quick problem-solving capabilities
TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations during our recruitment process. If you need assistance or an accommodation, please reach out to us at Accommodations-AMS@tiktok.com.

Every single day, Legrand brings power, light and data to millions of spaces around the world. Legrand is a global, publicly-traded company listed on the Euronext (Legrand SA EPA: LR) with 36,000 employees worldwide, a market cap of $16B, revenue of more than $5 billion, with products sold in 180 countries. Legrand is listed on the Forbes Global 2000 as one of the world’s best employers. For more information, visit legrand.com.

Legrand North and Central America (LNCA) employs over 5,000 associates in 60 locations, working in 6 product categories (Electrical Wiring Systems, Building Control Systems, AV, Data Communications, Power Distribution and Control, and Lighting). LNCA offers comprehensive medical, dental and vision coverage. LNCA offers distinctive benefits like high employer 401K match, above-benchmark paid maternity leave, paid time off to volunteer, and an active women’s network. LNCA is an employee-centered, growth company with tremendous opportunity. For more information, visit legrand.us.

Legrand’s Building Control Systems (BCS) division includes the Wattstopper and Solarfective product lines. Wattstopper offers the most comprehensive line of simple, scalable and flexible energy efficient lighting controls and solutions for commercial and residential applications. Solarfective gives Legrand customers the most energy efficient, easy-to-use advanced shading and lighting control solutions. Full Job Description
Internships at OppFi

At OppFi, interns make a real-world impact, handling projects that require higher-level thinking, collaboration, and leadership. Interns operate as full-time team members and have been responsible for creating systems, tools, and practices that tangibly improve our bottom line and are still used today.

As a participant in our internship program, you'll be part of a cohort of interns across 13+ departments. In addition to the work you'll do within your department, you'll get to know your fellow interns through a variety of collaborative projects and virtual social events.

We provide interns with career development opportunities including regular lunch and learns with leadership team members and a buddy program that pairs each intern with a tenured employee who serves as a friend and mentor. Our full-time employee base boasts a robust population of 20+ former interns, and whenever possible, we aim to extend full-time offers to interns who perform at a high level and achieve their summer goals.

This is a 10-week paid summer internship that will be remote flexible.

The Team

The Engineering team contributes to the development and improvement of the services we provide for our customers. Interns work alongside the full-time engineering team, learning basic principles of OppFis' business technology through coding, testing, deployment, and support of software. You'll gain valuable industry experience through developing services used across our entire technology platform.

Responsibilities

Web service development.
Financial data analytics.
Loan automation.
Credit scoring.
Data persistence and searching.
Machine learning.
API development.
Full stack web development.
Infrastructure as Code.
CI/CD Pipelines.

Required Skills

June 2023 or December 2022 graduation date.
Pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
Experience using a modern programming language in academic or previous internship experience. Our collective team background includes Ruby, Python, Node.js, Erlang, Java, Clojure, Apex, and C++. Show us you've solved non-trivial engineering problems with your language and we'll be interested in moving forward!

The Spectrum Internship Experience
You have clear aspirations and are seeking a summer internship program that will help you meet them. Find it at Spectrum, named one of the Top 100 Internship Programs in the United States by WayUp.

Our internships are designed to provide:
Opportunities to gain new skills and elevate the ones you already have, all in a robust and forward-thinking business setting.
First-rate, hands-on experience in the telecommunications industry.
Opportunities to connect you with people who can give you a better understanding of the industry and help you accomplish real goals you can add to your résumé, this includes assigning you a formal mentor and interactions with senior executives.

What you can expect in this role
As a Spectrum Intern, you’ll be essential to two teams — your respective department and your Intern peer group. Department and team-focused projects account for about 80% of your schedule. Planning and coordination of network initiatives involving the deployment of new network equipment and the modification of network architectures.

Process documentation and process improvement

Initiate and confirm adequate completion of services provided by datacenter vendors

Full Job Description
Company Overview

As a global leader in licensed sports merchandise, Fanatics is building the leading global digital sports platform and changing the way fans purchase their favorite team apparel, jerseys, headwear and hardgoods through an innovative, tech-infused approach to making and quickly distributing fan gear in today’s 24/7 mobile-first economy. Operating multi-channel commerce for the world's biggest sports brands, Fanatics offers the largest collection of timeless and timely merchandise whether shopping online, on your phone, in flagship stores, in stadiums or on-site at the world's biggest sporting events.

Through Fanatics’ innovative commerce capabilities and cutting-edge tech platform, the company has assembled one of the best databases of fans globally which is now being leveraged across the broader sports ecosystem to build new, large-scale digital sports businesses outside of merchandise. Fanatics is the majority owner of Candy Digital, a next generation digital collectibles company that is partnering with prominent sports properties - including MLB and MLBPA - to build an official NFT ecosystem where fans and collectors come to purchase, trade and share officially licensed NFT’s. Additional ventures that will build out Fanatics’ footprint across the broader digital sports landscape will be announced in the coming months.

Fanatics’ partners include all major professional sports leagues (NFL, MLB, NBA, NHL, NASCAR, MLS, PGA) and hundreds of collegiate and professional teams, which include several of the biggest global soccer clubs.

In addition to e-commerce, the capabilities of Fanatics include omnichannel-integrated physical retail operations across a broad portfolio of flagship stores, team retail and special events; international capabilities that provide a global sports retail platform; and an in-house merchandise and manufacturing division that is a licensed partner of professional and collegiate teams and helps fans express passion through a broad range of apparel and non-apparel products created under the Fanatics, Nike, Top of the World, Majestic and WinCraft brands.

As a market leader with more than 8,000 employees and over 300 partners, suppliers, and vendors in 11 countries, we take responsibility for driving toward more ethical and sustainable practices. We are committed to building an inclusive Fanatics community, reflecting and representing society at every level of the business, including our employees, vendors, partners and fans. Fanatics is also dedicated to making a positive impact in the communities where we all live, work and play through strategic philanthropic initiatives.

At Fanatics, we’re a diverse, passionate group of employees aiming to ignite pride and passion in the fans we outfit, celebrate and support. We recognize that diversity helps drive and foster innovation, and through our IDEA program (inclusion, diversity, equality and advocacy) at Fanatics we provide employees with tools and resources to feel connected and engaged in who they are and what they do to support the ultimate fan experience.

About the Team

Fanatics is first and foremost a technology company. We are powered by cutting-edge tech created by our small agile teams using the latest tools and technologies under our highly analytical, forward thinking, and open-minded leadership. As the global leader in licensed sports merchandise, we challenge ourselves by improving our new fully responsive NodeJS cloud commerce platform, Elasticsearch engine, and deep data science capabilities while building the best-in-class retail manufacturing and supply chain technologies. Our tech teams work together to revolutionize data science and engineering initiatives, provide highly scalable real-time and streaming platforms, and create secure e-commerce and in-stadium fan experience products. Our own e-commerce platform transacts in over 190 countries, 17 languages, and 14 currencies. Our motto is “#GSD”—get stuff done—and we do just that. If you want to be at the nexus of sports, commerce, and technology, come be a part of our industry-leading team here at Fanatics Tech.

ABOUT THE TEAM

Fanatics is first and foremost a technology company. We are powered by cutting-edge tech created by our small agile teams using the latest tools and technologies under our highly analytical, forward thinking, and open-minded leadership. As the global leader in licensed sports merchandise, we challenge ourselves by improving our new fully responsive NodeJS cloud commerce platform, Elasticsearch engine, and deep data science capabilities while building the best-in-class retail manufacturing and supply chain technologies. Our tech teams work together to revolutionize data science and engineering initiatives, provide highly scalable real-time and streaming platforms, and create secure e-commerce and in-stadium fan experience products. Our own e-commerce platform transacts in over 190 countries, 17 languages, and 14 currencies. Our motto is “#GSD”—get stuff done—and we do just that. If you want to be at the nexus of sports, commerce, and technology, come be a part of our industry-leading team here at Fanatics Tech.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Design and implement APIs and microservices for driving search, indexing and data services in a cloud-based eCommerce environment.
Understand and implement industry-standard programming patterns in conjunction with heavy performance optimization in services.
Model real-world problems through object-oriented and structural programming.
Act with a team in the development of cutting-edge applications and services, as well as collaborating with other business units.
Share technical knowledge with existing team.
Participate in a small, experienced, energetic team on a rapid, agile development schedule
REQUIREMENTS
Pursuing a degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience
Familiarity with agile development practices
Strong communication and analytical skills, including the ability to navigate ambiguity while working well with disparate teams
Ability to continuously deliver results under tight deadlines
Ability to approach work with an open, flexible outlook focused on innovation
Must be a creative thinker able to solve complex, highly technical problems
Ability to work in a challenging, fast-paced agile environment
Desire and ability to work as part of a team
Preferred: experience with Git Knowledge and experience with open-source frameworks and libraries
Pay range: $30-32/Hour

Tryouts are open at Fanatics! Our team is passionate, talented, unified, and charged with creating the fan experience of tomorrow. The ball is in your court now.

Ensure your Fanatics job offer is legitimate and don’t fall victim to fraud. Fanatics never seeks payment from job applicants. Fanatics recruiters will only reach out to applicants from an @fanatics.com or @fanatics.co.uk email address. For added security, where possible, apply through our company website at www.fanaticsinc.com/careers

Fanatics is committed to responsible planning and purchasing (RPP) practices, working with its business partners across its global and multi-layered supply chain, to ensure that planning, sourcing, and purchasing decisions, along with other supporting processes, do not impede or conflict with the fulfillment of Fanatics’ fair labor practices.

NOTICE TO CALIFORNIA RESIDENTS/APPLICANTS: In connection with your application, we collect information that identifies, reasonably relates to or describes you (“Personal Information”). The categories of Personal Information that we collect include your name, government issued identification number(s), email address, mailing address, other contact information, emergency contact information, employment history, educational history, criminal record, and demographic information. We collect and use those categories of Personal Information about you for human resources and other business management purposes, including identifying and evaluating you as a candidate for potential or future employment or future contract positions, recordkeeping in relation to recruiting and hiring, conducting criminal background checks as permitted by law, conducting analytics, and ensuring compliance with applicable legal requirements and Company policies.

A currently enrolled student that is selected for a GIS Intern position will spend time between a GIS Technologist and GIS Analyst role. GIS Technologists support the operation and maintenance of the company GIS application by maintaining, reporting, and posting work or by gathering data to be input by others. The GIS Technologist may support Distribution or Transmission functions. A GIS Analyst provides technical expertise to solve more complex problems with some supervision. Examples include completing special data and map requests, data collection, development of standard procedures and documents, and manipulation of metadata.

Interns are expected to work independently, or as part of a team, under close-to-moderate supervision, and to develop to advance their skills.

Responsibilities

Openly receives coaching and mentoring from other GIS Analysts and GIS Technicians

Conducts GIS and related studies.

Independently prepares thorough and accurate technical reports, correspondence, documentation, calculations and maps to be checked by mentor or supervisor

Develops, supports, troubleshoots and makes recommendations to custom GIS applications, scripts, tools, and web services

Understands, and interprets complex design drawings, property plats, maps, and other related information as necessary to post data in the Company GIS system

Translate project requirements into real-world GIS solutions that fit in with current programs, projects and initiatives

Assists with developing GIS desktop and web-based applications using ESRI products while integrating various other programming technologies

Reviews mapping data for quality and accuracy

Manipulates, analyzes and extracts geographic data from a complex array of datasets

Supports Customer Delivery during storm events

Basic Qualifications

Currently enrolled and pursuing a two or four-year degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, GIS, Geography, Geology or a closely related technical discipline

Valid driver's license

Cumulative GPA of at least 2.75

Desired Qualifications

Cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher

Experience with ESRI ArcGIS software; or any equivalent combination of training and experience which provides the required knowledge, skills and abilities.

Familiarity with querying and reporting information from databases using Python, SQL, Microsoft Report Builder (MRB), and/or Microsoft Power Business Intelligence (Power BI)

Ability to gain basic knowledge and experience in Electric Transmission and Distribution mapping, connectivity, and editing

Willingness to learn new software tools that support Electric Transmission and Distribution connectivity models.

Demonstrated excellent interpersonal skills with the ability and willingness to share information and transfer knowledge to others.

Demonstrated leadership skills

Demonstrated strong customer-service attitude.

Understanding of basic principles of project management.

Experience with troubleshooting technical and process-based issues

Hybrid – Work will be performed from both remote and onsite locations after the onboarding period. However, hybrid employees should live within a reasonable commute to a Duke Energy facility.

5-15%

We do this through utilizing and developing cutting-edge technology and pushing the envelope to bring stories to life through our movies, products, interactive games, parks and resorts, and media networks. Now is your chance to join our talented team as a Professional Intern in any of our segments that delivers unparalleled creative content to audiences around the world.

This intern will work closely with the Walt Disney World Design and Engineering Cyber Security team to participate in Cyber Security activities, largely around operating system patching, testing and documentation.

Work with Cyber Security personnel to generate necessary documentation around attraction security; specifically network diagrams, Theory of Operations and wiring diagrams

Must not have completed one year of continual employment on a Disney internship or program.
Must possess unrestricted work authorization

position: SAP iXp Intern - Marketing and Communications
description:
Full Job Description
What we offer

Our company culture is focused on helping our employees enable innovation by building breakthroughs together. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from. Apply now!

About the SAP Internship Experience Program

The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP

Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.

About the team

The Platform Adoption Advisory (PAA) team within SAP’s T&I COO office makes innovation real for SAP customers. From Silicon Valley, PAA scales innovation by embracing the entrepreneurial spirit and driving customer engagements within and beyond SAP. We take end-to-end ownership of delivering compelling proofs of concepts (POCs) focused on SAP’s Business Technology Platform for strategic customers. PAA generates new solutions and business models for SAP customers in a highly creative environment by incubating new ideas, demonstrating feasibility of new technologies, and supporting board level initiatives. We also work with our field organizations to identify high value business scenarios and enable innovation for strategic customers.

What you’ll do:
Position Title: SAP iXp Intern - Marketing and Communications
Location: Palo Alto, CA or Virtual
Expected Start Date: August 2021

Contract Duration: 6 months (Successful interns may be offered the opportunity to extend their internships if interested and available)

In this role, you’ll:
As part of PAA’s business operations, you will receive opportunities unlike any other internship experience. Some responsibilities bestowed upon you will include but are not limited to:

Creating and editing amazing sales & marketing collateral such as
customer stories,
project one-pagers,
promo videos,
and other materials that seek to promote the activities and achievements of the team
Managing and maintaining intranet webpages by providing both content and basic web development.
Assisting and reacting quickly to urgent requests from management and executives
Contributing to the success of internal & external presentations.
Supporting the planning and execution of internal & external meetings.
Creating and editing internal communications.
Supporting the reporting needs and requirements of PAA by routinely collecting, organizing, and analyzing:
Activities and statuses of ongoing innovation projects from our project management tool.
Market research of related trends and growth
Data from other reports
Special projects as assigned by managementDescribe the role: what is the project and deliverables?

Who you are:
We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stays curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.

The ideal candidate is a polymath who can take on multiple responsibilities and tasks, and can be a creative problem-solver across a wide-range of topics. The candidate must also be ready and willing to wear many hats and adapt to a fast-moving and constantly evolving business landscape. Therefore the ideal candidate must exhibit the following qualifications for consideration:

Currently enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate program preferably in one or more of the following areas of study:
Sales & Marketing
Communications
Business Administration
Finance
Mathematics
Statistics
Computer Science
The candidate must also possess,
An unwavering attention to detail
A strong analytical and creative mind-set
Tenaciousness in finding the best solutions to problems.
A “never quit” attitude
Excellent verbal and communication skills
Ability, willingness, and aptitude to learn SAP enterprise software
Expert knowledge of the Microsoft Office suite (Outlook, PowerPoint, Word and Excel)
Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (preferred)
Availability and means to work on-site on the SAP campus in Palo Alto (40 hours per week).
Finally,
Knowledge of Design Thinking is a great plus
A keen sense of humor is greatly appreciated

Please include some personal or portfolio work for us to see! (Instagram, blogs, photography, artwork, videos, etc.)

Follow @SAPiXp on Instagram and don’t miss anything about our experiences worldwide!

We are SAP

SAP innovations help more than 400,000 customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with 200 million users and more than 100,000 employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, we build breakthroughs, together.

Our inclusion promise

SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.

SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com.

EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:
Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

Overview:
We are not just offering a job but a meaningful career! Come join our passionate team!

As a Fortune 50 company, we hire the best employees to serve our customers, making us a leader in the insurance and financial services industry.
